Review: I have really curly hair that I heat straighten constantly. This is a great shampoo because it keeps my naturally dry hair from becoming dryer. The scent is a subtle gormand.  I definitely recommend.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: Love it!
Review: I love this shampoo it gives me a clean feeling without stripping all the moisture in my hair. It also smells lovely, and a little goes a long way, it doesn't take much for it to lather. I highly recommend!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: Inexpensive quality product!
Review: I love all of the Shea Moisture products I've tried. They last a long time, great for all kinds of hair. I have bleached, fine and thin hair and need quality hair care products and the price is very reasonable and quality is very nice.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: Not an every wash shampoo but great.
Review: Wow. I was truely surprised. It does not strip your hair but suds up like a shampoo. I would use this when my 4c hair is pretty clean but needs more of a cowash ( I don't believe in cowashes anymore). I really scrub my scalp when I use this.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: No slip!
Review: I love Shea Moisture anything but not this. The shampoo cause my hair to get tangled so bad, it felt like it was matted. I used a whole bottle of the conditioner to detangle which was a waste cause the conditioner had ABSOLUTELY no slip. I had to use a different conditioner just to moisturize and detangle. Sad because like I said, I love ANYTHING by Shea moisture  but not this.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: Good Product, Not Meant for My Hair Type
Review: I have a hard time writing a review for this. It really is a good product, but I don't think it was the right fit for my hair type and texture. I consider my hair to be 2C-3A waves/curls. My hair is fine and low-porosity. The scent and everything was great, but I found for my hair type it did not work well. It was not well moisturized and made it feel coarse.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: I just love this shampoo
Review: I have curly, wavy, dryer hair.  I just love this shampoo.  It doesn't weigh my hair down but it really moisturizes.  I like that there isn't a strong smell also.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: My hair loves it!!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: I like the smell of this.
Review: I can't tell you that it does much for my hair because I have very opinionated and belligerent hair. It doesn't really care what you put on it, it will do whatever it wants anyway. But this shampoo smells nice, like cedar and some other outdoorsy stuff, so there is that.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz

I'm a 4b 4c texture and It gave my hair so much bounce and curl definition I highly recommend this product for if you have dry could that need extra love !

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: Has helped with hair loss and thinning
Review: I am not one to change shampoos often and try to use the healthiest ones with less chemicals. I have been using this for months and see thickness and growth on the hair on my head. I also noticed it to be sofr and moisturized. I have had difficulty with hair loss and thinning in the past. I'm not a huge fan of the smell but it's tolerable.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: Excellent for 3C curls.
Review: Love it so much I now wash my hair twice in the shower (i know it's bad...but I love the smell so much). I want to try the all range, love it!

Title: Not worth it

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: The smell is amazing!!

Title: Meh...
Review: Okay SO. This shampoo smells freaking divine and definitely makes my hair soft... however, that's where the good parts unfortunately come to an end. By the end of day ONE that I washed my hair with this (and the accompanying conditioner), my hair is extremely greasy looking+feeling. I have dirty blonde, naturally thick hair that's basically like a lion's mane to tame and it still ends up looking like I haven't washed my hair in a few days. Moral of the story: lots of "build-up" left behind with this product, so I unfortunately will not be purchasing again :(

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: From Desert to Rainforest.
Review: I had been using a co-wash (I won't name it) that I'd thought to be good. It made my hair look and feel great the day of, and day after washing. However, I began to notice after those two days, my hair and scalp were dry. Sahara desert dry. I'd oil my scalp and the dryness would ensue.I needed a change. I decided, after remembering success with previous She Moisture products, to give this line a try: It changed my life.My hair went from parched to lush. My curls are more defined. My follicles are silky and strengthened. The shine factor is on 100 (People have been asking me if I had my hair dyed).Suffice it to say, this will be my go-to line of hair products. It works for me. The price is right. And it smells amazing.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: One Star
Review: Not what i expected

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: WORKED AMAZING FOR MY LOW PORISITY HAIR!
Review: I did not buy this on amazon i found it on clearance at walmart and i am so glad i decided to buy it! I chopped all of my hair off 5 months ago after being natural without a big chop for 3 years. My hair has been dry and hard to moisturize ( though its growing well) since. I have low porosity hair. This is literally the first time my hair has felt soft and moisturized  in a very long time! Ive tried many shampooes and this is the first i love!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: Works great for me!
Review: This is a great shampoo for dry, damaged hair.  It makes my hair soft and shiny and it smells like wildflower honey.  It definitely hydrates well and it leaves my hair manageable and soft. My hair is color treated and this shampoo is sulfate free and therefore color safe.  My hair is also very dry from heat styling and this shampoo moisturizes my parched strands nicely.  It's really thick and rich and it lathers well, unlike so many sulfate free formulas.  This is perhaps the most hydrating of all the Shea Moisture shampoos I've tried so it's probably not suitable for fine hair.  I also use the Manuka Honey conditioner, which is also very moisturizing and it has a lot of "slip" so detangling is easy.  The combination of these two products give me shiny, soft, hydrated tresses that respond well to my styling efforts.  The shampoo cleanses really well and the conditioner is very nourishing.  I really love them both and they have become holy grail products for me.  I definitely recommend this shampoo (as well as the conditioner) for anyone with dry, color treated hair.  However, you can pick this shampoo and conditioner up at Target or Ulta for $10-$11 apiece, so don't pay outrageous Amazon prices!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: More Clarifying Than It Is Hydrating...
Review: This line of Shea Moisture Hair products smells wonderful! And I want to add that I am in love with Shea Moisture as a brand. I have ALL of the products in the "Strengthen Grow & Restore" line of SM products but I wanted to venture out to try and find items that focused more on hydration. Thought I'd found it in these, especially with a name like INTESIVE HYDRATION, lol. This shampoo does a GREAT job of cleansing. After washing one time, you'll be able to feel that there's no more dirt in your hair which is not the case with the SG&R line (more about that in a separate review). So that is where the 3 stars come in because this Shampoo does a great job of CLARIFYING my hair. But why it doesn't receive 5 stars is because the hydration is just not "Intense" enough...I end up having to use lots of moisturizing products after I've shampooed and conditioned just to combat the severe dryness that is my hair. So in my opinion, it's a great product that tries very hard, but it does not deserve the "intensive hydration" title just yet.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: This shampoo does clean the hair really good for it to be moisturizing
Review: With Shea Moisture, knowing one's porosity and current state helps tremendously with selecting the right products. This shampoo does clean the hair really good for it to be moisturizing. I want to be careful with using the term "clarifying" because some people may have keratin-treated hair as such as myself and at all costs want to avoid that, ha-ha! However, this product's intentions were meant to hydrate dry and/or damaged hair. It is sulfate free and salt-free so if you do have keratin treated hair, I suggest this shampoo. The ingredients in it also help to heal and fight off scalp issues so this is ideal for me.Overall, this shampoo did leave my hair feeling conditioned. It was extremely prepped for the conditioner. My hair texture is wavy/curly and can easily dry out but it is on the finer side. I can not use the deep conditioner since it's too thick for my hair texture, but the conditioner could be applied to hair and used as a deep conditioner because it's lighter, yet equally hydrating.I want to monitor my hair's use with this product. It does contain hydrolyzed rice protein so if you are on the lower-porosity side, you may want to consider that. My hair is lower-porosity, but I don't mind the extra protein if it tries to clarify the keratin out of my hair, joking! I expect the results to vary for this but if you need hydration and a good cleanse, this would be a top choice since it's sulfate-free.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: Burns my scalp
Review: This product literally burned my scalp to the point of bloody scabs forming. The bottle I have has Fragrance (parfum) as the fourth ingredient, so I'm guessing that's what is irritating my scalp. I have the consitioner and mask from this line and they don't irritate my scalp at all. Very disappointed SM feels the need to add so much fragrance to a shampoo when it's just going to be washed down the drain anyway. I don't recommend trying this product, I have never had a reaction to something like this before.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: Worst shampoo EVER! SO bad.
Review: I actually like the scent. But the product quality itself.... SO bad. Go into your pantry, pull out a bottle of honey, wet your hair, dump on a bottle of honey, dump on a bottle of lotion. Just try just rinse it out. My hair has never felt so nasty!!! I had to deal for a week until my regular shampoo came in. Guess I'll use this shampoo as hand soap. Really pricey hand soap. There is absolutely nothing else you can use it for. Dont put it near your hair, you'll never be able to rinse out the nastiness. How does this product have any good reviews?! My hand actually got stuck in my hair when it dried after I used this stuff. Could not get a brush thru my hair either. It made me feel so gross.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: Too sudsy for me
Review: I have very thick 3B curls and I have not used regular shampoo for over 10 years, I normally just use a cheap conditioner or a low "poo" product as a cleansing agent.  I thought I'd give this a try as I really love the intensive conditioner in this same line.  It does say "no sulfates" but it is really way too sudsy and shampoo-y for my taste.  I will continue to use the intensive conditioner and use up the rest of this shampoo but go back to using conditioner or the Devacurl Low-poo cleaner which I've always liked.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: A god send!
Review: So far I am loving this. I just started with this product because my brother uses it so I had to purchase my own. Paired perfectly with the corresponding conditioner which I also purchased is a god send to my hair. Other shampoos and conditioners would dry my hair and leave it super tangled, but with this I just washed conditioned, removed excess water and went about my day. Also seems to be helping with frizz which is a big plus.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: Great For Low Prosity Hair!
Review: This shampoo, conditioner,  and mask is excellent for low prosity 3c, 4abc hair. Such Amazing lather with the shampoo! Silkness/slickness with conditioner and Mask has Ah-mazing Slip makes your waves and curls soft and pop!! This is a "definite" on natural hair gal list!!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: I have tried many shampoos since going natural 3 years ago and my hair hated most but managed to hang in there
Review: Finally!  It has happened to me!  A product that my hair loves.  I have tried many shampoos since going natural 3 years ago and my hair hated most but managed to hang in there.  My hair was so dry.  I had to apply products every day to keep it moisturizer.  Now I use Shea Hydrating and I don't have to use products every day.  I wash my hair with the shampoo, add lotion, greas, (yeah the Dax is still my go to y'all) and Black Castor Oil Lotion(this stuff is ahmazing!) and my hair loves it.  I can go out in the rain, humidity, etc. without my hair shrinking into a hard dry mess.  I must add that trimming your hair is a must.  I needed a serious trim and after that, my hair rocks.  Finally!  I love my natural hair and it feels so soft and luscious!  I just wished they made a bigger bottle but a little product goes a long way.  I would like a bigger bottle tho, just saying.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: has Manuka Honey ingredient which is a healing agent. Good stuff
Review: I love it. very nice and healing to my scalp and moisturizes my long natural curls. However the last shipment I received the safety seal was off and inside the cap and the bottle leaked a little in shipment. I was disappointed and my next purchase will be in the store so I can make sure the safety seal is on.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: Scent Is Too Strong, Irritates Scalp
Review: It does its job as a shampoo. I love the smell. HOWEVER, the smell is too strong. Any heavy perfumes added to hair products irritates my scalp, just like this one did. It made my scalp dry,  scabby and scaly. I cant do this anymore. In the trash it goes.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: Softens grey hair...
Review: Smells delicious and is moisturizing to natural hair. My hair is also going grey sanitizer is drier and wirey. This shampoo softens it.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: Disappointed
Review: Thought i finally found a shampoo and conditioner for my low porosity hair, after the first use my hair came out soft BUT fuzzy and lost curl definition. Im disappointed. Will this situation improve with continued use?

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: Great shampoo
Review: Love this shampoo, I've been using it for years, but I think this recent one had a manufacturing defect. It poured out like water when usually it is really thick. It seemed like it was 30% shampoo and 70% water, so much so it poured off my hand so it was hard to try to use it, I had to use half the bottle for one shampoo. I am still giving it a 4 because I really believe there was just something wrong with this one.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: Silk Making Magic
Review: My hair had a dryness with a thirst no moisturizer could quench until I started using this shampoo.  Since I have never been happy with sulfate-free shampoos, I had low expectations for this one. This shampoo lathers and cleanses well. My hair is soft from the time I rinse the shampoo out until the next time I wash my hair. The shampoo has a very pleasant smell and a little goes a long way. I can't imagine going back to any other shampoo.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: Moisturizing shampoo- not very good at cleaning
Review: The scent is wonderful. The shampoo is very gentle and does not clean as well as I thought it would. A quarter-sized amount or more of the shampoo is required even for short hair.

Title: Glad to have found it.
Review: I love this shampoo. I am able to start the detangling process right after a wash which is a first for me. As in, running my fingers through thick, 4c hair! The scent is yummy and the moisture is nice. I would recommend this for those with dry hair. I purchased mine through Ulta and not Amazon. Ulta always has coupon available so that helps in not being concerned with money lost when trying a new product. I think I am now reformed from my hair product hoarding way as I now have a staple shampoo and conditioner set.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: Seems to work great for 4c hair in a protective style
Review: I wash my hair once a week/ 10 days and because this has protein I use this and the conditioner as my protein wash every other week (I use the SM Black Soap purification masque and balancing conditioner as my protein free moisture wash in between)My hair is currently in twists but they seem to clean the scalp well and left my scalp just as soft and moisturized as the Black soap range- which I love!The real test will be washing my hair once out of a protective style.The Manuka Honey range has a much better smell than the the other SM ranges too.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: I'm glad I got to try this shampoo because it is ...

This one has a nice rich moisturizing lather and cleans well even with oils in my hair. It leaves hair really soft and almost don't need a conditioner after. Nothing like the greasy/dried out feeling of the Raw shea line.

Title: Thumbs down in my opinion
Review: I bought this shampoo because of all the great reviews it had, but I personally do not like it at all. Iâ€™m usually not one to go out of my way to write a negative review, I just personally really didnâ€™t like this shampoo at all. It was very oily and it smells awful. This really is a preference thing, but it ruined it for me. It leaves an oily residue on your hands after you wash your hair. I was just not a fan.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: Left residue on roots
Review: I love the smell of this shampoo! I read a few places this is one of the best shampoos for your hair because of the ingredients so I gave it a try. Unfortunately, it left a thick residue on my roots, and it made my hair a bit ratty feeling. The day after, I had to wash with dandruff shampoo to get all the residue out. I'm going to give it another try because I really want to love this shampoo. It might actually be too moisturizing! :\

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: Great quality
Review: Absolutely love this!!! I ordered this and tha matching conditioner....for some dumb reason...I called myself wanting to dye my hair cause I thought I was going to get my hair colored and dreaded up...lmao!!! That didn't happen.....so my hair kinda broke off and was extremely dry...but since I hadn't had a relaxer in a yr that kind of helped! But after using this tha first time my hair was so soft and I could actually comb through it! I left tha conditioner in over night with flat twists and rinsed it out tha next day!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: Good Stuff
Review: I love the shampoo. It's rich, creamy and you only need a small amount to make a great lather.  My hair feels really clean, but not the dryness I felt from other shampoos for hair for "people of color".  A nice moisturizing shampoo!I'll definitely buy it again!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: Verified Purchase
Review: I have to say I'm pretty impressed. I've not had any luck trying Shea Moisture products in the last two years. I've tried various, especially from the famed Coconut and Hibiscus line and hated every single one of them due to their sickly stench and the amount I had to use to look just barely presentable. My hair was made frizzy so I gave them away to my mum who also hated them and threw them away. I was very put off trying Shea Moisture again but seeing so many new product lines and their introduction to stores near me, which otherwise neglect curly hair products, made me want to try once more.This was a pleasant surprise. It smells perfumed and slightly earthy. When wet it smells like macadamia nuts, which I like, so it made me rather pleased. The first time I used it, I had to prepare myself to throw it away because it instantly made my strands stick together as it lathered up so fiercely. But after washing it out fully, my hair felt fine. Not super moisturised like the product claims, honestly, but the way I've always expected from a gentle shampoo. My hair doesn't feel stripped, but just before that stage at super clean. My scalp isn't irritated, I'm guessing that's due to the lack of hard sulfates as I can no longer use regular shampoos that make my scalp burn and itch.I'm still questioning whether I should get it again because As I Am's Coconut Cowash is super moisturising and cleansing at the same time. And I really have a lot of hair and want to keep my wash routine to as minimal steps as possible and the cowash lets me get away with not needing to shampoo and then condition. We'll see, but so far the cowash is winning out as it is also the cheaper of the two for a bigger volume of product. So, if the shampoo were cheaper, I might just designate it my new default cleanser. That being said, I love the packaging and my success with this product has encouraged me to not completely give up hope buying Shea Moisture products in the future.Now if only a wider variety was available' on Amazon...Edit: After much deliberation, I've decided to go back to my cowash. It's cheaper and all of the scabs and itchiness that I used to deal with daily from my sulfate conditioners have returned with this shampoo. It is NOT SULFATE FREE. I do feel lied to, I look on the ingredients, while it has only softer sulfates in it, they're still sulfates. I decided to continue using it because I wanted to give the product a chance but now my scalp is suffering and my hair has become extremely dry over time (this being the only new product to be incorporated into my regular routine) to the point where I have had to cut my hair. I found that many companies are now labelling their products as sulfate free and are not, so be careful.

This shampoo will suit everyone but to ladies of a certain age I say GO FOR IT you won't regret it

Title: Verified Purchase
Review: Iâ€™ve been using this shampoo for more than two years now and always loved it, BUT I recently bought another bottle and something has certainly changed! It lathers up just like other sulphate shampoos, convincing me this is NOT sulphate free. I knew something was wrong when I poured it out of my latest bottle - the consistency and colour were different. Then it lathered up on use. Sulphate free shampoos do not lather! The ingredient list has changed. Theyâ€™ve now started using fake fragrance (aka Parfum) instead of natural fragrance sources. The ingredients they list as not being included has drastically reduced (i.e., the bad stuff in the shampoo is increasing). Itâ€™s a shame that a brand like theirs is trying to cut corners to make a quick buck at the cost of giving customers a truly good, natural product. Donâ€™t expect the same shampoo if youâ€™ve been a regular user like me!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Shampoo for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil Sulfate-Free 24oz
Title: Verified Purchase
Review: Mi sono trovata mallissimo con questo prodotto ho pensato ch'era il top del top ma niente aparte di lasciatmi i capelli durissimi me l'ha fatto annodare questa linea non vale per i miei capelli relaxed

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Great for 4b/4c hair
Review: This stuff always conditions my hair so nice. The slip is amazing and leaves your hair feeling moisturized! I just wish they make this product without the pump it doesn't come out as good with it on.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Helps to revive dyed and burned hair.
Review: This product was a lifesaver for my dyed and burned hair!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Fantastic regular 3-5 minute conditioner
Review: I have natural 4b hair. Unlike the deep conditioner version, this version makes my hair feel so soft and moisturized. After rinsing out I have unbelievable curls, definition and shine. Its weird that the deep conditioner version doesnt work as welll. Would recommend buying this regular conditioner version. I use it with every wash day.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Beware amazon products arenâ€™t always Genuine!! I have had some that are great and others not!
Review: Iâ€™ve bought a few of these off Amazon, I have long hair and need a new bottle about every 4 weeks.The product I received this last time  was sub par.  My hair is soo dry, i kept adding more and more and it wasnâ€™t working to condition my hair. I ended up using a product that isnâ€™t as â€œheavyâ€ and had better results.Shea Moisture manuka Honey is a Amazing Product, but sometimes youâ€™re not getting what your buying.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: good price but smell is overwhelming and causes allergy
Review: I love Shea Moisture products and can generally tolerate smell but this was so over-the-top strong smelling that I returned it.  It also caused itching and allergy.Thank you Amazon for your great return policy!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Doesn't rinse out
Review: This conditioner was so difficult to wash out. It took forever to rinse me hair and it felt like unless I stood under the water for 15 minutes rinsing, then it left a residue. I definitely will not buy it again.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: The Most Moisturizing Hair Conditioner Ever
Review: The packaging is very nice. The colors made me feel a sense of peace and harmony. I like the colors so much.  Itâ€™s easy to use and easy to hold.  I like that it had a pump because usually the jar conditioners get water in them from the shower, but the pump keeps the conditioner un- diluted and when I  finish with the conditioner,  I  turn the spout closed to keep the conditioner fresh and free of air. I Love the scent;  vanilla - honey. I love the ingredients. The texture-consistency is thick. I have  a combination of 2c-3a-c hair andSheaMoisture Manuka Honey & Mafura Oil Intensive Hydration Conditioner melted into my hair. It was a great experience.  It has slip and 3 minutes after  applying it to pre-sectioned hair,  I finger detangled and kept it in my hair until I finished my shower. The conditioner left my skin hydrated too. I Love this conditioner and will buy again. Definitely going to recommend.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Fantastic conditioner
Review: I have always had dry hair and now that I have highlights, it can get really dry. This conditioner is awesome and I love the scent.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Best product I own!
Review: Omg this is the best product I own! And I own a lot! I saw someone use this as a leave in and decided to give it a try. Omg life changer. It smells great, makes my hair feel great, and look great!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: THE SMELLLL ðŸ˜³
Review: Iâ€™m African American with relaxed hair and I have to say this product has gave my hair a lot more moisture! The back of my head is always the driest so Iâ€™m not surprised that itâ€™s still kind of dry back there, but the rest of my hair felt soft and moisturized. T H E  S M E L L I S  S O  N I C E, I don't even know how else to describe it! This product also made my hands very soft but beware, I received it in the mail and it kept spilling from the top so I had to wipe it down like 3 times and also because of this virus going around. After i wiped it I topped it up real tight and the problem was solved! I ordered another and these things ship really fast, the first one arrived really quick. I'm still stuck on the smell though, its so good and i will continue to use this on my hair.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: I was a skeptic but I really like this on my black dry hair
Review: I'm a black guy and never really thought about using anything in my hair, since I usually cut my hair low. But decided to grow it out this year to a little fro. So of course, now I notice my hair is dry and coarse and leaves me with dry scalp. That changed when my wife told me to get something for my hair.Decided to start with this conditioner after reading the reviews and after 2 times using it, my hair is noticeably softer, easier to manage (pick and comb) and no more dry scalp or tangles in the hair.This may have different results for other people but from going to using NOTHING in my hair for 30 years to using this, it is a HUGE improvement. I will be getting their hydrating shampoo next to test that out.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: The best conditioner I have ever used!
Review: I have naturally curly hair. Maybe 2C or 3A/3B, I don't know. I could never figure it out. It's dry, it's frizzy. It's thick, long, curly hair. I use a wet brush in the shower after putting in this conditioner, and it's like a magic elixir. Knots slip away. And it's not like a detangler....no. It doesn't feel slippery(or somehow dry) at all like that. I've been using it for about a year and it has transformed my hair. So much less frizz. I don't even use a frizz product anymore. I use a little of this as a leave in. In fact, I only barely wash it out when I wash my hair. On days I don't wash my hair, I wet it a bit and add a few pumps of this conditioner.  I have no more breakage and my hair is super soft and smells divine. All this PLUS it's not tested on animals (very important to me) nor does it have harmful chemicals. And they give to charitable causes.I will use this forever if possible!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Not good for long straight hair prone to tangle
Review: With all the high reviews, I wanted to like this conditioner, but it did nothing to condition my very long straight hair that is prone to get tangled.  Perhaps this would be good for someone with a different type of hair, but for me it was a big waste of money as I still needed other conditioning products afterwards to actually condition and detangle my hair.  Plus I thought it smelled strange, like some kind of patchouli or musky smell, not what I want my clean hair to smell like.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Smells fantastic
Review: This stuff smells amazing and, true to its word, makes my hair crazy soft. I have to use T-Sal shampoo for a scalp condition, which dries my hair out to straw, and this counteracts that in a way a lot of other conditioners don't.I will say that I use a ton of this every time because it doesn't lather and seems to kind of disappear as I try to work it into my hair ... it's about the consistency of hand lotion so in thick or long hair a little bit doesn't seem to go far. Also I have 2c/3a curly hair and while this seems to prevent frizz, it loosens the curls up instead of defining them, so they have about half the volume I'm used to. Could be a good thing, depending on your hair type; for me it means I use an additional product to get the shape back.Seriously, though, I'd buy it for the smell.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Hair softer than it has been in months.
Review: So I have dry damaged hair that needs some love. I've tried various products and none of quite delivered. I need a few more dollars for free shipping and this had high reviews so I tried it out.I just got it today so here is my first impression.The smell is good but super strong. If they halved the smell it would be perfect.I just got my hair wet in the shower and applied root to tip. I Saturday every strand and put a shower cap on. Lefted on for 20 minutes and rinsed with cold water. I then took a small pump and worked it into my damp hair as a leave in.Now nothing is a miracle conditioner so my hair still isn't the best, however it feels better than it has in a couple months. I'll keep using it and update how my hair feels after I finish my first bottle

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Bottle and pump need improvement
Review: Love everything about this product and other similar conditioners from this company... except the pumps. Iâ€™ve bought this and others several times and I always have to take off the pump and dispense without it when Iâ€™m barely halfway through using the bottle. Itâ€™s like the pump wonâ€™t support the thickness of the product. A squeeze bottle with cap would work much more effectively. In fact, I took a cap from another bottle (I believe a shampoo) and it worked perfectly up until the end. Improve the packaging and this would be a perfect product.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: It smells nice and my natural hair was soft and manageable after ...
Review: It smells nice and my natural hair was soft and manageable after using but it also caused some minor itching and irritation.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: The best
Review: I wonâ€™t buy any other shampoo. Since using this for a month less frizz my hair looks healthier feels soft and for the 1st time since Iâ€™ve decided to grow my hair out I love my hair. I have thick hair. With both shampoo & conditioner I can tame my crazy hair. Best part itâ€™s not dried out and more. It has took a month to see a difference but wow. Iâ€™ve always hated my hair. Not now. Shampoo does make a difference and how u use it. I highly recommend

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: My product must have been OLD...
Review: I haven't tried this conditioner and the first time I used it was when I wasn't feeling too well, and I thought it was just my sense of smell playing tricks on me...so I had my old man come into the bathroom to take a whiff of my hair, and after two seconds he made a face confirming that this stuff is indeed SMELLY. It smells like something...at least one of the ingredients has gone putridly BAD. I still tried to use it, followed by another better smelling conditioner, but I'm not sure it even works well anymore.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Helped my damaged hair
Review: Wasnâ€™t expecting to like this conditioner as much as I do! My son sat next to me and asked me what smelled good and it was my hair lol Also my husband is super sensitive to scents and usually hates all the perfumes and body washes I get but he liked this. Before I got in the shower my hair was a bit tangly and afterward it got all the tangles out just from conditioning it. Definitely hooked me with that.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: From Desert to Rainforest.
Review: I had been using a co-wash (I won't name it) that I'd thought to be good. It made my hair look and feel great the day of, and day after washing. However, I began to notice after those two days, my hair and scalp were dry. Sahara desert dry. I'd oil my scalp and the dryness would ensue.I needed a change. I decided, after remembering success with previous She Moisture products, to give this line a try: It changed my life.My hair went from parched to lush. My curls are more defined. My follicles are silky and strengthened. The shine factor is on 100 (People have been asking me if I had my hair dyed).Suffice it to say, this will be my go-to line of hair products. It works for me. The price is right. And it smells amazing.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Love these products
Review: I have used many of Shea's products and none of them have disappointed me. I utilize their leave in conditioners as well as the ones you rinse out. I have curly hair that tends to get frizzy easily. My only dislike is this pump bottle. When the product is almost finished, it is difficult to retrieve the bottom contents. I end up having to take the pump off and bang the bottle or add water and use the rest. Same issue with their body lotions. They are thick and well made but difficult to retrieve from the bottles.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Not sure if it the true product
Review: Iâ€™ve bought this product several times from Sallyâ€™s and Walmart, however due to the coronavirus Iâ€™ve not been out so I bought this online. It doesnâ€™t smell the same or feel the same at all! I really hope itâ€™s the true product as I STRICTLY follow the curly girl method and do not put products in my hair thatâ€™s not curly girl approved

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Softens, Moisturizes The Co. donates 10%  to Community Commerce
Review: It has a nice honey smell.  It's color safe. The only thing I didn't like was the way it arrived. It should have been wrapped in bubble wrap or a bubble pouch. The top push dispenser arrived broken off because they just threw the item in the box it seems. Fortunately it didn't leak or spill and all of the contents are there. When I use it I will just have to remove the cap which is not a big problem or anything.  13 ounces for under $10 so this will last for some time. Overall I am happy with the product and this purchase.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Smells great, definitely "conditions" but sticks to my hair like none other...
Review: I really want to like this conditioner, and for reference I have 3A curls, but for whatever reason this product weighs super heavy on my hair. Not only that but it makes my curl pattern extra strange and seperate more in a weird way so they are thinner vs thicker by the end of the day. My biggest grip would be the leftover residue after a shower. It's as if I had put in a leave-in but instead of softness it has more of a waxy feel.I'd imagine this product works well for someone with very very fine and dry hair. I personally have very thick, not to dry strands which may be why this didn't work for me. The smell is great and it feels good to put in my hair and detangle during the shower but thats it...

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: You wonâ€™t regret buying this !!!
Review: This is absolutely my favorite conditioner! The scent is subtle and so wonderful. I once used use a cheap shampoo and my hair felt sooooo dry and stripped so I decided to give this conditioner a try and oh my words itâ€™s the best decision Iâ€™ve ever made. It melted into my strands and immediately my hair felt so moisturized and looked healthy and shiny. I love love love this conditioner and the hair mask in this line is heaven sent as well. Donâ€™t second guess just purchase ! You wonâ€™t regret it !

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Greasy
Review: This smells fantastic, but unfortunately no amount of rinsing worked to get it out, I rinsed for about 3 minutes the second time I used it and it still left my hair greasy and gross, it even made it shed out way more than normal. My daughter had the same problems. Thankfully they refunded me no problem.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: This product has protein in it!
Review: I have 3C/4A high porosity virgin hair and I follow the curly girl method. I was not aware that this had protein in it. I used it right before I did a protein treatment and one side of my hair came out crunchy. Luckily, I noticed and performed two deep condition treatments to fix the issue. I would not recommend this product to individuals who have hair like mine.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: It's really thin, about the consistency of cheap lotion
Review: I only bought this because it was recommended as a beard co-wash by one of my favorite Youtubers and i regret spending the $7 lol. It's really think so idk if it's counterfeit but i do know that most Shea moisture products i'm familiar with seem to have a thicker consistency. I'm bout the whole She Moisture Men's beard line and a lotion and them were all thick and had a weight to them. This product is very thin and has no real moisturizing or conditioning properties. You're better off either buying it from a real store or going trying a different product altogether.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: If you have coarse & dry hair, this conditioner wonâ€™t cut it
Review: I have coarse, wavy Asian hair that has been chemically processed (balayage and dyed). My hair is pretty dry and I had high hopes for this conditioner, but it was pretty disappointing. It was thin and not very moisturizing. I used about 2 big handfuls to cover my hair and I had to add a different conditioner, because it just wasnâ€™t cutting it. Smells lovely though!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Great for my 2B,2C, 3A textures
Review: I have a different curl patterns in different sections of my head and have allot of hair .I have a mix of normal & thick hair strands. Ive been searching for an amazing conditioner for so long ! This is it, this conditioner changed the game for me ! I use this conditioner with this type of shampoo, hair masque, and use curl cream and Dippity Doo gel :) i have good hair days now :â€™) I used to be insecure of my birds nest looking for the right products to use !

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Smells lovely!
Review: My favorite thing about this conditioner is the smell. There are lots of great conditioners out there but what makes this one distinctive is its wonderful scent. It even lingers throughout the day after you have rinsed it off (which some people may or may not want in a conditioner). In addition to the scent, it makes my hair smooth but not greasy looking. My hair definitely feels healthy and full after using it.Update: The dispenser on the conditioner broke after about a week. This is the second time that it's happened with this product (I assumed the first time was a fluke). It doesn't bother me too much--it's easy to just take the cap off and use it that way but it is worth noting. Still a great conditioner though.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Crunchy Hair
Review: I tried this and the paired shampoo as a high moisture shampoo/conditioner as a replacement for the Devacurl Decadence line (made my scalp itchy). I have high porosity, 3b/3c curls that need a lot of moisture, so I thought for sure that this "intensive hydration" combo would be a good fit. Not the case, unfortunately. After the first use, my hair is crunchy, dry, and rough. Really bummed, but will be looking for other products.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Love Love Love!
Review: Smell is amazing and so are my results. You only need a little of this amazing stuff. Iâ€™ve been natural for 8 years and since Iâ€™ve been using Shea Moisture Products my hair has responded completely different in terms of moisture and growth. This works especially well for those of us that suffer from dry hair (a lot of natural women do) Try it and see for yourself. Love this stuff!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Is it the glycerin?
Review: I don't know what it is about my hair and Shea Moisture, but the brand does not work for me (with one exception). I have fine, color-treated, long 3A curls, and I co-wash. This was too heavy and left my hair both greasy and frizzy. I had a similar problem with the much-recommended coconut-hibiscus line. In contrast, the JBCO leave-in does work for me. In short, fine-haired curlies look elsewhere.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Stinks
Review: The smell. Horrible! The most strongest perfume scented conditioner I've ever used. I bought it to use on my daughter's ethnic curls and the smell lasts for DAYS. Even others have made comments, like, "what is in her hair, that's so strong!" I make sure to rinse it really well, but it doesn't help.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: My favorite so far.
Review: Light conditioner, not hard to coat hair. I ring out my hair after shampooing and let it sit for a few minutes to ensure the conditioner is used efficiently because its more on the pricy side. I loved how my hair felt and looked afterwards. Accentuated the texture in my hair, no frizz and not weighted down. The bottle did leak a bit in shipping.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Finally a conditioner I like!
Review: I've recently gotten into using conditioners without sulfates, parabens, phthalates, or dimethicone and this one is great. It smells like honey and it made my hair feel so nice and soft and my hair smells fantastic. This conditioner is pretty light in consistency but you don't need much to get the benefits. I have long natural blonde curly/wavy dry hair and this worked great for me.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: I really like this conditioner
Review: I bought this product along with the shampoo and I really like it. It smells very good and moisturizes my strands. I have about 3a-3b hair and it works really well! The only issue I have with this conditioner is how much I find myself using. The consistency is very thin and I find myself using multiple pumps to get my hair to the softness I want. The scent is also pleasant, I really enjoy it but for some it may be a bit strong. This scentâ€™s intensity can be easily overcome by a leave in conditioner or a leave in hair oil though. Overall, would recommend buying.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Not moisturizing!
Review: When I bought this product it said it was ultra hydrating and moisturizing.. that is not the case. The product itself is really thin, not something I would typically describe a moisturizing conditioner to be. Along with it being a very thin product, I donâ€™t think itâ€™s very moisturizing at all. I put about 4 pumps of product onto my hair, and it felt like almost nothing was there. Iâ€™m sad to say that I didnâ€™t enjoy this product, because I love Shea Moisture products

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Dissatisfied...
Review: This product has the Honey as 14th ingredient and it only says Honey and not Manuka Honey. The package came open and I got half of the product in the bottle. Besides those two things is a good product for now... I honestly thought it had better ingredients.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Excellent Results
Review: This stuff, in combination with Shea Moisture Bamboo Charcoal Deep Cleansing Shampoo works very well. My hair is very thick and coarse and I had some dandruff going on before I used these two products.  Dandruff is gone, my hair has never been this soft and easy to comb. Even when my hair has dirty build-up, the shampoo always lathers up the first time. I highly recommend these two products. Two thumbs up to Shea Moisture. Oh, I am a middle aged black man.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Loving it but arrived just half of it
Review: I love the product but only half of it arrived. Awful package (no protection). It's my holy grail but seriously, why would you send a fluid product like that?Previous review: I have a 3B low porosity hair and I'm actually using this as a leave-in conditioner. The smell is quite peculiar but after a bit, you just get used to it and I really like it, it leaves my hair bouncy with just scrunching. The only downside is that if I leave my hair just with this product for more than two days it starts to look greasy but, anyway, it's not designed to be used a leave in. It just takes really good care of my hair so as a conditioner or even to use as deep conditioner (use a plastic cap and leave it all night) it's just amazing!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Not much to really like it.
Review: I'm still using it but its not exactly helping my dry hair.Final review,  it doesnt help, no changes to my dry hair.  Im using coconut oil now.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Not what I was hoping for
Review: I think I must be slightly allergic to something in this, it burns when it touches my scalp. I bought this thinking it'd be good to rehydrate my hair after swimming... it's actually worse than my regular conditioner. My hair is frizzier and crispier.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Quick review
Review: Iâ€™ve stopped using product because of its thickness.  If you have low porosity  hair you can mix it with water which will help. However, itâ€™s too much work doing it all the time.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: This is everything
Review: I had a bad reaction to coconut when I used this the first time. Turns out it was the hair oil I used along with this with coconut as the first ingredient. GET THIS if you have a sensitivity to coconut, but you want to get something that will make your hair feel and smell amazing!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: BEST Natural Conditioner I have found for curly, thick, coarse, long hair.
Review: I have unruly, curly, frizzy, coarse, and long hair.  I have never really found a product that isn't bought in a salon for $$$$ that works to tame my mane.  A few years ago, I started looking into these products I was using. Everything from hair care, to skin and face care, to what I was eating, soap, toothpaste, and found that many of these products were poisoning me.  Well, I started to switch out my products, but it has taken me 3 YEARS to finally find this beautiful product.  It works even better than any of the old salon products I have used to moisturize and add shine to my hair (Tame the mane!), and unfortunately, much better than any other comparatively natural products I have tried up until this point. The waitress at the local diner that I frequent even commented that my hair looked healthy! (YAY!) Anyways, I'm going to quit ranting, but I can't say enough good things about this product, and for the price, it's a steal. Try it,  you won't regret it.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Love Love Love It!
Review: Absolutely the best natural conditioner I've ever used... I have thick, fine to medium, color treated Caucasian hair that has a slight wave to it. I've moved away from shampoos/conditioners that have sulfates and silicones as silicones will coat the hair shaft and keep moisture out. You can slather your hair with any moisturizer/oil but if the hair shaft is covered in silicone, it won't penetrate. I use the Shea Moisture Retention shampoo and follow with the Manuka Honey & Mafura Oil Conditioner; which I leave on for a few minutes in the shower. I find it has plenty of slip (for a non-silicone product) and the scent is FABULOUS. My hair is shiny, healthy and full of body - and did I mention the fabulous scent?? I loved the smell so much I bought the Manuka Honey & Mafura bar soap at my local Fred Meyer store, which actually moisturized better than the Olay body wash I'd been using, without the harsh sulfates and chemicals. Totally love this line :)

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Great for THICK curly hair! Must try!
Review: I've been using this conditioner for years prior to buying it on amazon (cheaper than Target). But I went to the reviews, and noticed that they do not do this product justice at all; so I wanted to leave an informative review! This conditioner is thick and hydrating; you want to make sure your hair is very wet when applying to create slip which allows for easy detangling (I use a spray bottle). It is great to pair with an oil - I detangle with just the conditioner and add coconut oil on my shaft and scalp afterwards to seal the moisture. Then you would want to let it sit in your hair for over 30 minutes (I understand the bottle says otherwise, and you don't reap the benefits in 3-5 minutes). I usually let mines sit in my hair overnight in a plastic cap (or at least 30 min. if I'm in a hurry). Note, a plastic cap or sitting under a dryer allows the product to penetrate the follicles even further; leaving your hair silky soft.  Before you know it, your hair will be revitalized! This is perfect when coming from protective styles and from straightening your hair; but this is my every week conditioner! I have kinky curly thick wavy curls (hard to describe I think ima a 3C/4A mix) - I actually donâ€™t like the deep masque conditioner but this one I def recommend for 3/4 hair types. As a former product junky, I hope this helped someone!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Holy grail for low porosity hair
Review: I took care of my hair. Didn't dye it, used sulfate-free/silicone-free everything, hardly used heat on it, but one day I noticed my curls weren't what they used to be (2c, 3a). They were stretched out and limp. I tried protein treatments and "deep conditioners" to no prevail. I tried at least 4 different regular conditioners but none seemed to help with moisture (even the ones $30+). I finally found out that I have severely low porosity hair when I did the strand test and after an hour my hairs were still floating on top. Desperate, I tried this on a whim. I've tried other Shea Moisture products before and liked them, but never found a conditioner I loved. Enter this stuff. I paired it with their almond oil (I leave on overnight from scalp to ends then wash the next day) and my hair has transformed from broken, snapped strands and dry limp frizz, into silky strands with strength. I can't stop touching it! Those two products are the only items that have actually penetrated my low porosity hair and I'm crazy grateful to feel normal again. My curls are back and bouncy! (The almond oil has made my hair and eyebrows grow like crazy too.)

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Behentrimonium chloride is a harmful chemical. AVOID
Review: I am not a fan of chemicals in my products. I reccomend everyone to throughly read and look up the ingredients.  This product has Behentrimonium chloride.Other reviewers say it was hard to wash off,  and it's bc of this ingredient.Here is one info o found online. "It is a toxic compound, and concentrations of .1% and higher have been shown to damage the eyes by causing tissue death of the mucous membranes. Itâ€™s also highly flammable, Â irritating to the skin and can cause anÂ increased risk of cancer, nerve damage, anemia and disintegration of the kidneys."Read and research...

I just combed out my locs after 5 years so Iâ€™m starting my natural hair journey from scratch and this is the only product Iâ€™ve found so far that my hair absolutely LOVES itâ€™s so incredibly moisturizing I just want to leave it in forever and it smells heavenly. I hate heavy conditioners that leave residue and weigh me down. It also smells really good, like honeyed syrup. My hair is less frizzy after washing it, I will probably buy more for my mum and me.

Title: Moisture rich detangling
Review: I love this conditioner  and the shampoo for that matter. For the first time, while natural (nearly 4 years now), I've found a product that adequately hydrates AND detangles my dense, 4c hair. Combing through it is a cinch. Blow drying is too. The smell, I love it. I know a few have said its a bit much but I think that is a preference thing. I am pretty discriminating when it comes to scent and the strength thereof and find the smell to be highly tolerable but then again, preference. Glad I gave it a try.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Your hair may require more than this product is willing to give.
Review: Smells wonderful...all natural ingredients...spreads easily through hair and doesn't leave hair tangled after using. Also, it's pretty fast acting in that you don't have to leave it on for longer than 5-10 minutes. It gives the illusion of being soft and able to maintain, but I feel that it could be a bit better at actually HYDRATING  the hair. So in conclusion, I would recommend this product if your hair already has great moisture retention and just needs a boost here and there. But if you need more than a boost, don't waste your money!

Title: Miracle for bleached hair
Review: This stuff is amazing. You can get it cheaper in store at Ulta though. My hair is bleach blonde (I'm white, but my hair is crazy dry from the bleach) and after using this my hair feels incredibly smooth. I used my waver and the shine was amazing. It also smells really nice and it doesn't fade out fast. My hair normally is easy to make greasy, even though it's very very dry, but this product just makes my hair incredible, it's outright transforming how much nice my hair looks and feels when I use this. My only complaint is that the shampoo doesn't really lather, I'm used to lather. I keep recommending it to other women with bleached hair, that's how much I love it.

Title: Good for fine, dry, frizzy, Caucasian hair
Review: I've tried several Shea Moisture conditioners and this is one of the best for my very fine, dry, frizzy, curly, Caucasian hair that tangles and breaks easily. The other one I like is the Coconut Hibiscus conditioner. They both detangle the best for me and have the best scent in my opinion. I tried the Raw Shea Butter and the Rose conditioners, and those did not detangle well for me at all, and I didn't care for the scent of those either.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Smells Great, But Itches like Hell
Review: This conditioner smells AMAZING and I like how it wafts down from my hair through the day. It has great slip, which is nice for my Type 4 hair, but unfortunately it's more drying instead of moisturizing, or maybe irritating, but by the end of the day, no matter what I try, my scalp itches like crazy when I use this. Mentioned it to other people I've seen use it and they've mentioned the same thing. Sucks cause I'm really in love with the smell. The Deep Masque Treatment did the same thing. Worried to try any of the other products in this collection.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Works great for me!
Review: This conditioner is really good for dry, damaged hair.  My hair is color treated and I also use heated styling tools several times a week so dryness is always an issue.  This conditioner hydrates really well, leaving my hair soft and shiny.  It also has a lot of "slip" so detangling is easy and it smells like wildflower honey!  It's really rich and thick and I've found that leaving it on for about 5 minutes helps it work even better.  I also use the Manuka Honey shampoo, which is sulfate free and therefore color safe.  It lathers really well and is very moisturizing.  When I use these two products, my hair is very smooth and soft and very manageable.  I've been using them for about a month and definitely notice a big difference.  My hair is very healthy looking now and super shiny and frizz free.  These products have done wonders for my dry, lifeless tresses.  I definitely recommend them both.  However, you can purchase them at Ulta or Target for $10-$11 apiece, so don't pay the outrageous Amazon price!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Verified Purchase
Review: The ingredients listed are not accurate.  See the photo of the bottle I received. It contains limonene which was not listed on Amazon as an ingredient and the photo in the listing has a different ingredient list.  I am allergic to citrus so I cannot eat citrus or have it in my body products.  No limonene, citronellol,  geraniol, etc. It gives me a terrible, red, itchy rash.  This is why I check the ingredients of everything I buy because these substances are in practically everything from deodorant, body wash, laundry detergent, shampoo, etc.  I bought this conditioner after carefully reading the ingredients and then when I received the product, the ingredients were different. I did not notice until after I used it and broke out in a rash. Then I checked the bottle and there it was! Limonene!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil deep moisturizing conditioner 24oz
Title: Verified Purchase
Review: I have heard a lot of good things about Shea Moisture so decided to dip my toe in the water and change up my routine. I can happily report that I'm glad I did! I have mixed race wavy grade hair and decided that the ingredients would lend this to be an effective leave in, I saw no reason to wash it out. Firstly on opening the bottle I was pleased by the smell, it's gorgeous without being overly cloying. If you're a honey fan like me it's a definite keeper! The slip is good whilst massaging into the scalp and roots, and I have lots of bounce and shine after allowing my hair to naturally air dry. I paired my conditioner with a Shea Moisture shampoo and do believe I will continue with this brand for a while so I'm very glad I found it. My strands feel hydrated from scalp to tip, and my curls last for several days. I can easily detangle my hair with my fingers to keep my hair from breaking, and I have seen great results using this as my regular co wash product every other week.

Review: This conditioner was so difficult to wash out. It took forever to rinse me hair and it felt like unless I stood under the water for 15 minutes rinsing, then it left a residue. I definitely will not buy it again.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: The Most Moisturizing Hair Conditioner Ever
Review: The packaging is very nice. The colors made me feel a sense of peace and harmony. I like the colors so much.  Itâ€™s easy to use and easy to hold.  I like that it had a pump because usually the jar conditioners get water in them from the shower, but the pump keeps the conditioner un- diluted and when I  finish with the conditioner,  I  turn the spout closed to keep the conditioner fresh and free of air. I Love the scent;  vanilla - honey. I love the ingredients. The texture-consistency is thick. I have  a combination of 2c-3a-c hair andSheaMoisture Manuka Honey & Mafura Oil Intensive Hydration Conditioner melted into my hair. It was a great experience.  It has slip and 3 minutes after  applying it to pre-sectioned hair,  I finger detangled and kept it in my hair until I finished my shower. The conditioner left my skin hydrated too. I Love this conditioner and will buy again. Definitely going to recommend.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Fantastic conditioner
Review: I have always had dry hair and now that I have highlights, it can get really dry. This conditioner is awesome and I love the scent.

Title: Best product I own!
Review: Omg this is the best product I own! And I own a lot! I saw someone use this as a leave in and decided to give it a try. Omg life changer. It smells great, makes my hair feel great, and look great!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: THE SMELLLL ðŸ˜³
Review: Iâ€™m African American with relaxed hair and I have to say this product has gave my hair a lot more moisture! The back of my head is always the driest so Iâ€™m not surprised that itâ€™s still kind of dry back there, but the rest of my hair felt soft and moisturized. T H E  S M E L L I S  S O  N I C E, I don't even know how else to describe it! This product also made my hands very soft but beware, I received it in the mail and it kept spilling from the top so I had to wipe it down like 3 times and also because of this virus going around. After i wiped it I topped it up real tight and the problem was solved! I ordered another and these things ship really fast, the first one arrived really quick. I'm still stuck on the smell though, its so good and i will continue to use this on my hair.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: I was a skeptic but I really like this on my black dry hair
Review: I'm a black guy and never really thought about using anything in my hair, since I usually cut my hair low. But decided to grow it out this year to a little fro. So of course, now I notice my hair is dry and coarse and leaves me with dry scalp. That changed when my wife told me to get something for my hair.Decided to start with this conditioner after reading the reviews and after 2 times using it, my hair is noticeably softer, easier to manage (pick and comb) and no more dry scalp or tangles in the hair.This may have different results for other people but from going to using NOTHING in my hair for 30 years to using this, it is a HUGE improvement. I will be getting their hydrating shampoo next to test that out.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: The best conditioner I have ever used!
Review: I have naturally curly hair. Maybe 2C or 3A/3B, I don't know. I could never figure it out. It's dry, it's frizzy. It's thick, long, curly hair. I use a wet brush in the shower after putting in this conditioner, and it's like a magic elixir. Knots slip away. And it's not like a detangler....no. It doesn't feel slippery(or somehow dry) at all like that. I've been using it for about a year and it has transformed my hair. So much less frizz. I don't even use a frizz product anymore. I use a little of this as a leave in. In fact, I only barely wash it out when I wash my hair. On days I don't wash my hair, I wet it a bit and add a few pumps of this conditioner.  I have no more breakage and my hair is super soft and smells divine. All this PLUS it's not tested on animals (very important to me) nor does it have harmful chemicals. And they give to charitable causes.I will use this forever if possible!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Not good for long straight hair prone to tangle
Review: With all the high reviews, I wanted to like this conditioner, but it did nothing to condition my very long straight hair that is prone to get tangled.  Perhaps this would be good for someone with a different type of hair, but for me it was a big waste of money as I still needed other conditioning products afterwards to actually condition and detangle my hair.  Plus I thought it smelled strange, like some kind of patchouli or musky smell, not what I want my clean hair to smell like.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Smells fantastic
Review: This stuff smells amazing and, true to its word, makes my hair crazy soft. I have to use T-Sal shampoo for a scalp condition, which dries my hair out to straw, and this counteracts that in a way a lot of other conditioners don't.I will say that I use a ton of this every time because it doesn't lather and seems to kind of disappear as I try to work it into my hair ... it's about the consistency of hand lotion so in thick or long hair a little bit doesn't seem to go far. Also I have 2c/3a curly hair and while this seems to prevent frizz, it loosens the curls up instead of defining them, so they have about half the volume I'm used to. Could be a good thing, depending on your hair type; for me it means I use an additional product to get the shape back.Seriously, though, I'd buy it for the smell.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Hair softer than it has been in months.
Review: So I have dry damaged hair that needs some love. I've tried various products and none of quite delivered. I need a few more dollars for free shipping and this had high reviews so I tried it out.I just got it today so here is my first impression.The smell is good but super strong. If they halved the smell it would be perfect.I just got my hair wet in the shower and applied root to tip. I Saturday every strand and put a shower cap on. Lefted on for 20 minutes and rinsed with cold water. I then took a small pump and worked it into my damp hair as a leave in.Now nothing is a miracle conditioner so my hair still isn't the best, however it feels better than it has in a couple months. I'll keep using it and update how my hair feels after I finish my first bottle

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Bottle and pump need improvement
Review: Love everything about this product and other similar conditioners from this company... except the pumps. Iâ€™ve bought this and others several times and I always have to take off the pump and dispense without it when Iâ€™m barely halfway through using the bottle. Itâ€™s like the pump wonâ€™t support the thickness of the product. A squeeze bottle with cap would work much more effectively. In fact, I took a cap from another bottle (I believe a shampoo) and it worked perfectly up until the end. Improve the packaging and this would be a perfect product.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz

I have thick hair. With both shampoo & conditioner I can tame my crazy hair. Best part itâ€™s not dried out and more. It has took a month to see a difference but wow. Iâ€™ve always hated my hair.
