Before I got in the shower my hair was a bit tangly and afterward it got all the tangles out just from conditioning it. Definitely hooked me with that.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: From Desert to Rainforest.
Review: I had been using a co-wash (I won't name it) that I'd thought to be good. It made my hair look and feel great the day of, and day after washing. However, I began to notice after those two days, my hair and scalp were dry. Sahara desert dry. I'd oil my scalp and the dryness would ensue.I needed a change. I decided, after remembering success with previous She Moisture products, to give this line a try: It changed my life.My hair went from parched to lush. My curls are more defined. My follicles are silky and strengthened. The shine factor is on 100 (People have been asking me if I had my hair dyed).Suffice it to say, this will be my go-to line of hair products. It works for me. The price is right. And it smells amazing.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Love these products
Review: I have used many of Shea's products and none of them have disappointed me. I utilize their leave in conditioners as well as the ones you rinse out. I have curly hair that tends to get frizzy easily. My only dislike is this pump bottle. When the product is almost finished, it is difficult to retrieve the bottom contents. I end up having to take the pump off and bang the bottle or add water and use the rest. Same issue with their body lotions. They are thick and well made but difficult to retrieve from the bottles.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Not sure if it the true product
Review: Iâ€™ve bought this product several times from Sallyâ€™s and Walmart, however due to the coronavirus Iâ€™ve not been out so I bought this online. It doesnâ€™t smell the same or feel the same at all! I really hope itâ€™s the true product as I STRICTLY follow the curly girl method and do not put products in my hair thatâ€™s not curly girl approved

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Softens, Moisturizes The Co. donates 10%  to Community Commerce
Review: It has a nice honey smell.  It's color safe. The only thing I didn't like was the way it arrived. It should have been wrapped in bubble wrap or a bubble pouch. The top push dispenser arrived broken off because they just threw the item in the box it seems. Fortunately it didn't leak or spill and all of the contents are there. When I use it I will just have to remove the cap which is not a big problem or anything.  13 ounces for under $10 so this will last for some time. Overall I am happy with the product and this purchase.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Smells great, definitely "conditions" but sticks to my hair like none other...
Review: I really want to like this conditioner, and for reference I have 3A curls, but for whatever reason this product weighs super heavy on my hair. Not only that but it makes my curl pattern extra strange and seperate more in a weird way so they are thinner vs thicker by the end of the day. My biggest grip would be the leftover residue after a shower. It's as if I had put in a leave-in but instead of softness it has more of a waxy feel.I'd imagine this product works well for someone with very very fine and dry hair. I personally have very thick, not to dry strands which may be why this didn't work for me. The smell is great and it feels good to put in my hair and detangle during the shower but thats it...

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: You wonâ€™t regret buying this !!!
Review: This is absolutely my favorite conditioner! The scent is subtle and so wonderful. I once used use a cheap shampoo and my hair felt sooooo dry and stripped so I decided to give this conditioner a try and oh my words itâ€™s the best decision Iâ€™ve ever made. It melted into my strands and immediately my hair felt so moisturized and looked healthy and shiny. I love love love this conditioner and the hair mask in this line is heaven sent as well. Donâ€™t second guess just purchase ! You wonâ€™t regret it !

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Greasy
Review: This smells fantastic, but unfortunately no amount of rinsing worked to get it out, I rinsed for about 3 minutes the second time I used it and it still left my hair greasy and gross, it even made it shed out way more than normal. My daughter had the same problems. Thankfully they refunded me no problem.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: This product has protein in it!
Review: I have 3C/4A high porosity virgin hair and I follow the curly girl method. I was not aware that this had protein in it. I used it right before I did a protein treatment and one side of my hair came out crunchy. Luckily, I noticed and performed two deep condition treatments to fix the issue. I would not recommend this product to individuals who have hair like mine.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: It's really thin, about the consistency of cheap lotion
Review: I only bought this because it was recommended as a beard co-wash by one of my favorite Youtubers and i regret spending the $7 lol. It's really think so idk if it's counterfeit but i do know that most Shea moisture products i'm familiar with seem to have a thicker consistency. I'm bout the whole She Moisture Men's beard line and a lotion and them were all thick and had a weight to them. This product is very thin and has no real moisturizing or conditioning properties. You're better off either buying it from a real store or going trying a different product altogether.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: If you have coarse & dry hair, this conditioner wonâ€™t cut it
Review: I have coarse, wavy Asian hair that has been chemically processed (balayage and dyed). My hair is pretty dry and I had high hopes for this conditioner, but it was pretty disappointing. It was thin and not very moisturizing. I used about 2 big handfuls to cover my hair and I had to add a different conditioner, because it just wasnâ€™t cutting it. Smells lovely though!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Great for my 2B,2C, 3A textures
Review: I have a different curl patterns in different sections of my head and have allot of hair .I have a mix of normal & thick hair strands. Ive been searching for an amazing conditioner for so long ! This is it, this conditioner changed the game for me ! I use this conditioner with this type of shampoo, hair masque, and use curl cream and Dippity Doo gel :) i have good hair days now :â€™) I used to be insecure of my birds nest looking for the right products to use !

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Smells lovely!
Review: My favorite thing about this conditioner is the smell. There are lots of great conditioners out there but what makes this one distinctive is its wonderful scent. It even lingers throughout the day after you have rinsed it off (which some people may or may not want in a conditioner). In addition to the scent, it makes my hair smooth but not greasy looking. My hair definitely feels healthy and full after using it.Update: The dispenser on the conditioner broke after about a week. This is the second time that it's happened with this product (I assumed the first time was a fluke). It doesn't bother me too much--it's easy to just take the cap off and use it that way but it is worth noting. Still a great conditioner though.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Crunchy Hair
Review: I tried this and the paired shampoo as a high moisture shampoo/conditioner as a replacement for the Devacurl Decadence line (made my scalp itchy). I have high porosity, 3b/3c curls that need a lot of moisture, so I thought for sure that this "intensive hydration" combo would be a good fit. Not the case, unfortunately. After the first use, my hair is crunchy, dry, and rough. Really bummed, but will be looking for other products.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Love Love Love!
Review: Smell is amazing and so are my results. You only need a little of this amazing stuff. Iâ€™ve been natural for 8 years and since Iâ€™ve been using Shea Moisture Products my hair has responded completely different in terms of moisture and growth. This works especially well for those of us that suffer from dry hair (a lot of natural women do) Try it and see for yourself. Love this stuff!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Is it the glycerin?
Review: I don't know what it is about my hair and Shea Moisture, but the brand does not work for me (with one exception). I have fine, color-treated, long 3A curls, and I co-wash. This was too heavy and left my hair both greasy and frizzy. I had a similar problem with the much-recommended coconut-hibiscus line. In contrast, the JBCO leave-in does work for me. In short, fine-haired curlies look elsewhere.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Stinks
Review: The smell. Horrible! The most strongest perfume scented conditioner I've ever used. I bought it to use on my daughter's ethnic curls and the smell lasts for DAYS. Even others have made comments, like, "what is in her hair, that's so strong!" I make sure to rinse it really well, but it doesn't help.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: My favorite so far.
Review: Light conditioner, not hard to coat hair. I ring out my hair after shampooing and let it sit for a few minutes to ensure the conditioner is used efficiently because its more on the pricy side. I loved how my hair felt and looked afterwards. Accentuated the texture in my hair, no frizz and not weighted down. The bottle did leak a bit in shipping.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Finally a conditioner I like!
Review: I've recently gotten into using conditioners without sulfates, parabens, phthalates, or dimethicone and this one is great. It smells like honey and it made my hair feel so nice and soft and my hair smells fantastic. This conditioner is pretty light in consistency but you don't need much to get the benefits. I have long natural blonde curly/wavy dry hair and this worked great for me.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: I really like this conditioner
Review: I bought this product along with the shampoo and I really like it. It smells very good and moisturizes my strands. I have about 3a-3b hair and it works really well! The only issue I have with this conditioner is how much I find myself using. The consistency is very thin and I find myself using multiple pumps to get my hair to the softness I want. The scent is also pleasant, I really enjoy it but for some it may be a bit strong. This scentâ€™s intensity can be easily overcome by a leave in conditioner or a leave in hair oil though. Overall, would recommend buying.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Not moisturizing!
Review: When I bought this product it said it was ultra hydrating and moisturizing.. that is not the case. The product itself is really thin, not something I would typically describe a moisturizing conditioner to be. Along with it being a very thin product, I donâ€™t think itâ€™s very moisturizing at all. I put about 4 pumps of product onto my hair, and it felt like almost nothing was there. Iâ€™m sad to say that I didnâ€™t enjoy this product, because I love Shea Moisture products

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Dissatisfied...
Review: This product has the Honey as 14th ingredient and it only says Honey and not Manuka Honey. The package came open and I got half of the product in the bottle. Besides those two things is a good product for now... I honestly thought it had better ingredients.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Excellent Results
Review: This stuff, in combination with Shea Moisture Bamboo Charcoal Deep Cleansing Shampoo works very well. My hair is very thick and coarse and I had some dandruff going on before I used these two products.  Dandruff is gone, my hair has never been this soft and easy to comb. Even when my hair has dirty build-up, the shampoo always lathers up the first time. I highly recommend these two products. Two thumbs up to Shea Moisture. Oh, I am a middle aged black man.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Loving it but arrived just half of it
Review: I love the product but only half of it arrived. Awful package (no protection). It's my holy grail but seriously, why would you send a fluid product like that?Previous review: I have a 3B low porosity hair and I'm actually using this as a leave-in conditioner. The smell is quite peculiar but after a bit, you just get used to it and I really like it, it leaves my hair bouncy with just scrunching. The only downside is that if I leave my hair just with this product for more than two days it starts to look greasy but, anyway, it's not designed to be used a leave in. It just takes really good care of my hair so as a conditioner or even to use as deep conditioner (use a plastic cap and leave it all night) it's just amazing!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Not much to really like it.
Review: I'm still using it but its not exactly helping my dry hair.Final review,  it doesnt help, no changes to my dry hair.  Im using coconut oil now.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Not what I was hoping for
Review: I think I must be slightly allergic to something in this, it burns when it touches my scalp. I bought this thinking it'd be good to rehydrate my hair after swimming... it's actually worse than my regular conditioner. My hair is frizzier and crispier.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Quick review
Review: Iâ€™ve stopped using product because of its thickness.  If you have low porosity  hair you can mix it with water which will help. However, itâ€™s too much work doing it all the time.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: This is everything
Review: I had a bad reaction to coconut when I used this the first time. Turns out it was the hair oil I used along with this with coconut as the first ingredient.  I have natural hair and this stuff was AMAZING.  I bought two sets of shampoo and condition because it was a great price.  GET THIS if you have a sensitivity to coconut, but you want to get something that will make your hair feel and smell amazing!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Scent is too strong
Review: What a bummer.  Looking at the product, I thought it had all the natural ingredients.  Somehow the scent was very strong, too strong for no reasons.  If you are sensitive to strong fragrance, I would not recommend this.  It made me a little sick.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Scent is TOO Overpowering, very disappointed.
Review: We are a family that enjoys using Shea moisture products. We tried this conditioner and no one in our family likes it. The scent is SO strong!! ðŸ˜³ If you read in the ingredients it just says â€˜fragrance (essential oil blend)â€™ as one of the first few ingredients. Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Wonderful
Review: I have fine, porous, brittle, wavy hair that dries out easily, and it makes my hair soft and manageable (I can get a comb through it without a ton of breakage). It seems like this works even better for my hair than their mask with the manuka/mafura.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Product opened
Review: Product came opened, the seal on these products is for a reason, an opened product should not be sold due to potential risk factors. Looking at other reviews this isnâ€™t common, but it just happened to me. Wonâ€™t consider buying again

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Better that expected!!
Review: I have tried very luxury and expensive hair creams and conditioners and this one is my best. It is healthy, moisturizing and has good price!! Thanks!!!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Best conditioner ever!
Review: I bought this along with the shampoo and leave in conditioner of the same scent. This conditioner is AMAZING! My hair was so moisturized and easy to manage and I had zero tangles. My hair was so easy to part and blow dry. I usually go to the salon but because of the weather I had to do it at home. I canâ€™t wait for the next 3 weeks when I have to do my hair again. If youâ€™re on the fence donâ€™t hesitate. Buy it!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Doesn't work well
Review: Did not work well. Smells amazing but the masque works better. This conditioner did not hydrate at all (it was used on two hair types 2b and 3b both untreated/not dyed). The shea moisture curl & shine conditioner works a lot better to hydrate and take care of frizz.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Be cautious
Review: There is fragrance in this conditioner's ingredient and they didn't include it in the ingredients list on Amazon.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Moisturizes Hair But Scalp Itches
Review: The product is definitely a bit moisturizing. I purchased the shampoo and conditioner, and have used them twice. But strangely, my scalp has been itching me since. I re-read the ingredients just to ensure that it was all natural. I cannot seem to put my finger on why this would be happening.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Horrible, horrible cedar stink
Review: Had to wash my hair 4x after using this shampoo and conditioner to rid it of extremely strong cedar smell. Overwhelmingly scented if you are sensitive. Not a honey smell at all, more creosote.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Awww! Nice smell & hair is not greasy.
Review: I like this really well! I always have a large plastic cup to put some cream rinse then water & mix with your hand. Pour over your head slowly & rinse! Mixes into you hair much better this way. Enjoy!!! ps...I'm really picky too!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Amazing but
Review: For some reason it treats my hair very well. Except for the very ends on my hair. They are much dryer then the rest of the hair. Smell is okay, not pleasant, and the pump gives you very minimal so youâ€™ll be pumping it onto your hand for a while.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Strong smell is ofputting
Review: I read many reviews and didn't come across anything to prepare me for how strong this product smells.  I am not certain of the scent, but it strikes me as smelling strongly of "sandalwood"...?It had an overwhelming perfume smell that only subsides a bit with rinsing/drying.  I was super excited to try It due to the positive reviews and am disappointed that it is unusable for me because of the scent.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Moisture but make it âœ¨Not thereâœ¨
Review: I have 4b low porosity hair and when I used a bit of it to curls the ends of my braids it seemed to work really good but when I got in the shower it wasnâ€™t all that. I had to use more than usual to moisturize my hair. I love the hair mask though it get my curls poppin. Anybody with low porosity hair have any conditioner recommendations?

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Seems legit
Review: Iâ€™ve bought this in stores before, but this price on amazon seemed pretty good. It arrived leaking over itself and the box. But the pump still works and most of the product is still in it. The consistency and scent match what Iâ€™m used to from this product so it seems authentic. I will just buy in stores from now on to avoid messes like this.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Great haiaar goo
Review: My hair isn't dry or damaged but I have used this product for about 4 years now and I love the way it holds without making the hair stiff.  I use it after drying out of the shower and love it.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Great as a deep conditioner
Review: I used this product for the first time to moisturize my hair.  I wear protective styles so you often need to so something to bring moisture back.  So far Iâ€™m pleased with this product.As a deep conditioner, I apply the cream and sit under a plastic cap for about 20 minutes.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Did not detangle
Review: Me and my daughters have very dry, curly hair. I did not like this conditioner for any of us. It did not condition and definitely did not help detangle. I couldn't brush any of our hairs in the shower. I would not recommend.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Best â€œcleanâ€ conditioner
Review: Best â€œcleanâ€ conditioner Iâ€™ve found. Yes others work better but no other â€œcleanâ€ or well rated conditioners work this well. I used to use live clean brand until I found they arenâ€™t as â€œcleanâ€ as they claim to be. I did feel it worked better but this is the best working brand for a â€œcleanâ€ product.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: This makes my hair supple.
Review: My hair is thick and wavy, so I've used various hair treatments, including products with silicone, to make it silky smooth. SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner is the best treatment I have ever used to make my hair naturally supple. The only reason I gave 4 stars is it doesn't have the floral scent that I prefer.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Safe and lovely
Review: The best!!!!  My 3 yrs old curly-haired girl and me both love it to keep our really long hair soft and untangled!  Plus, I use an app called Yuka, that rates product chemical content, and this one is a winner!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: It smells great it's not a great conditioner though
Review: My son has loose curly hair and I had high hopes for this conditioner. It makes his hair easier to comb out but it doesn't leave it conditioned all day.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: My new go toâ€¦for now.
Review: Iâ€™m a guy. Iâ€™m not too picky, but for whatever reason thereâ€™s some absolute junk out there in regards to conditioner and shampoo for that matter. So now Iâ€™m picky. This stuff is great. Youâ€™ll love it.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Hated it!
Review: Much cheaper conditioners performed better - did not moisturize or untangle my hair.  I would not buy this brand again.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: The best conditioner I have ever used
Review: The difference this conditioner made in my hair has been miraculous. My hair went from continually being dried out every day to being softer and holding in more moisture than ever before. I even had people notice the difference in the feel of my hair. I'll continue to use this for awhile.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Good Product
Review: I reallt like the moisture and softness I get with this product. It has a great smell and I love that it's a pump. But I feel like I have to used 2x-3x the amount of product than other comparable products.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Itâ€™s alright
Review: LOVE the smell of this conditioner. I can smell it on my hair for almost 2 days straight. Just wish the conditioner was more moisturizing. I have very fine silky healthy hair and this still isnâ€™t enough for my liking. Leaves my hair super tangled  and itâ€™s super hard to brush after I get out of the shower. My hair was way easier to brush when using my old conditioner. Feel like if you have super dry damaged hair you might want to try a different conditioner.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz

Disappointing overall.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Do not purchase
Review: I am not sure if this is the real product. My scalp was burning and my hair became extremely dry and broke off in patches in the back. Unfortunately I do not trust purchasing hair care products on Amazon anymore. Kind of scary

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Good but not what I was hoping
Review: I wanted to try a healthier conditioner to use as a leave in and unfortunately this one wasnâ€™t it. It leaves my hair super soft! But doesnâ€™t define my curls at all. Would only recommend this product as a regular conditioner. Their mask is amazing tho, been using that for sometime and itâ€™s my favorite!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Great for Curly/Coily/Kinky Hair
Review: The scent is great, the condition is good to use for in between deep conditioning and it doesn't irrate my sensitive scalp. The deep conditioner is good to use every other week within this sub product line. This leaves my hair feeling soft, easier to manage my 3b-4a hair to detangle in the shower and out the shower.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: BEST Natural Conditioner I have found for curly, thick, coarse, long hair.
Review: I have unruly, curly, frizzy, coarse, and long hair.  I have never really found a product that isn't bought in a salon for $$$$ that works to tame my mane.  A few years ago, I started looking into these products I was using. Everything from hair care, to skin and face care, to what I was eating, soap, toothpaste, and found that many of these products were poisoning me.  Well, I started to switch out my products, but it has taken me 3 YEARS to finally find this beautiful product.  It works even better than any of the old salon products I have used to moisturize and add shine to my hair (Tame the mane!), and unfortunately, much better than any other comparatively natural products I have tried up until this point. The waitress at the local diner that I frequent even commented that my hair looked healthy! (YAY!) Anyways, I'm going to quit ranting, but I can't say enough good things about this product, and for the price, it's a steal. Try it,  you won't regret it.

Title: Meh...
Review: Okay SO. This conditioner smells freaking divine and definitely makes my hair soft... however, that's where the good parts unfortunately come to an end. By the end of day ONE that I wash my hair with this (and the accompanying shampoo), my hair is extremely greasy looking+feeling. I have dirty blonde, naturally thick hair that's basically like a lion's mane to tame and it still ends up looking like I haven't washed my hair in a few days. Moral of the story: lots of "build-up" left behind with this product, so I unfortunately will not be purchasing again :(

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Love Love Love It!
Review: Absolutely the best natural conditioner I've ever used... I have thick, fine to medium, color treated Caucasian hair that has a slight wave to it. I've moved away from shampoos/conditioners that have sulfates and silicones as silicones will coat the hair shaft and keep moisture out. You can slather your hair with any moisturizer/oil but if the hair shaft is covered in silicone, it won't penetrate. I use the Shea Moisture Retention shampoo and follow with the Manuka Honey & Mafura Oil Conditioner; which I leave on for a few minutes in the shower. I find it has plenty of slip (for a non-silicone product) and the scent is FABULOUS. My hair is shiny, healthy and full of body - and did I mention the fabulous scent?? I loved the smell so much I bought the Manuka Honey & Mafura bar soap at my local Fred Meyer store, which actually moisturized better than the Olay body wash I'd been using, without the harsh sulfates and chemicals. Totally love this line :)

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Great for THICK curly hair! Must try!
Review: I've been using this conditioner for years prior to buying it on amazon (cheaper than Target). But I went to the reviews, and noticed that they do not do this product justice at all; so I wanted to leave an informative review! This conditioner is thick and hydrating; you want to make sure your hair is very wet when applying to create slip which allows for easy detangling (I use a spray bottle). It is great to pair with an oil - I detangle with just the conditioner and add coconut oil on my shaft and scalp afterwards to seal the moisture. Then you would want to let it sit in your hair for over 30 minutes (I understand the bottle says otherwise, and you don't reap the benefits in 3-5 minutes). I usually let mines sit in my hair overnight in a plastic cap (or at least 30 min. if I'm in a hurry). Note, a plastic cap or sitting under a dryer allows the product to penetrate the follicles even further; leaving your hair silky soft.  Before you know it, your hair will be revitalized! This is perfect when coming from protective styles and from straightening your hair; but this is my every week conditioner! I have kinky curly thick wavy curls (hard to describe I think ima a 3C/4A mix) - I actually donâ€™t like the deep masque conditioner but this one I def recommend for 3/4 hair types. As a former product junky, I hope this helped someone!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Holy grail for low porosity hair
Review: I took care of my hair. Didn't dye it, used sulfate-free/silicone-free everything, hardly used heat on it, but one day I noticed my curls weren't what they used to be (2c, 3a). They were stretched out and limp. I tried protein treatments and "deep conditioners" to no prevail. I tried at least 4 different regular conditioners but none seemed to help with moisture (even the ones $30+). I finally found out that I have severely low porosity hair when I did the strand test and after an hour my hairs were still floating on top. Desperate, I tried this on a whim. I've tried other Shea Moisture products before and liked them, but never found a conditioner I loved. Enter this stuff. I paired it with their almond oil (I leave on overnight from scalp to ends then wash the next day) and my hair has transformed from broken, snapped strands and dry limp frizz, into silky strands with strength. I can't stop touching it! Those two products are the only items that have actually penetrated my low porosity hair and I'm crazy grateful to feel normal again. My curls are back and bouncy! (The almond oil has made my hair and eyebrows grow like crazy too.)

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Behentrimonium chloride is a harmful chemical. AVOID
Review: I am not a fan of chemicals in my products. I reccomend everyone to throughly read and look up the ingredients.  This product has Behentrimonium chloride.Other reviewers say it was hard to wash off,  and it's bc of this ingredient.Here is one info o found online. "It is a toxic compound, and concentrations of .1% and higher have been shown to damage the eyes by causing tissue death of the mucous membranes. Itâ€™s also highly flammable, Â irritating to the skin and can cause anÂ increased risk of cancer, nerve damage, anemia and disintegration of the kidneys."Read and research...

I just combed out my locs after 5 years so Iâ€™m starting my natural hair journey from scratch and this is the only product Iâ€™ve found so far that my hair absolutely LOVES itâ€™s so incredibly moisturizing I just want to leave it in forever and it smells heavenly. Iâ€™ve got a ton of 4b/c hair with thin strands I think low porosity? Cool water has 0 effect on my hair. Hope this helps.

Title: Great
Review: Awesome stuff! It does what it says on the bottle. It conditions hair and leaves it feeling soft and manageable after washing. It feels like a light lotion and provides enough slip (well at least for me, straight hair) to detangle. My favorite aspect of this conditioner is that it rinses fast, easily, and cleanly. I hate heavy conditioners that leave residue and weigh me down. It also smells really good, like honeyed syrup. My hair is less frizzy after washing it, I will probably buy more for my mum and me.

The smell, I love it. I know a few have said its a bit much but I think that is a preference thing. I am pretty discriminating when it comes to scent and the strength thereof and find the smell to be highly tolerable but then again, preference. Glad I gave it a try.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Your hair may require more than this product is willing to give.
Review: Smells wonderful...all natural ingredients...spreads easily through hair and doesn't leave hair tangled after using. Also, it's pretty fast acting in that you don't have to leave it on for longer than 5-10 minutes. It gives the illusion of being soft and able to maintain, but I feel that it could be a bit better at actually HYDRATING  the hair. So in conclusion, I would recommend this product if your hair already has great moisture retention and just needs a boost here and there. But if you need more than a boost, don't waste your money!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Works great for me!
Review: This conditioner is really good for dry, damaged hair.  My hair is color treated and I also use heated styling tools several times a week so dryness is always an issue.  This conditioner hydrates really well, leaving my hair soft and shiny.  It also has a lot of "slip" so detangling is easy and it smells like wildflower honey!  It's really rich and thick and I've found that leaving it on for about 5 minutes helps it work even better.  I also use the Manuka Honey shampoo, which is sulfate free and therefore color safe.  It lathers really well and is very moisturizing.  When I use these two products, my hair is very smooth and soft and very manageable.  I've been using them for about a month and definitely notice a big difference.  My hair is very healthy looking now and super shiny and frizz free.  These products have done wonders for my dry, lifeless tresses.  I definitely recommend them both.  However, you can purchase them at Ulta or Target for $10-$11 apiece, so don't pay the outrageous Amazon price!

Title: Wow. I was hesitant but it was definitely worth it.
Review: I am so glad I got this. I've heard so many good things about this product but after trying their virgin coconut oil line (horrid) I was a little worried. (The picture is of my ends right after I woke up the next day)Pros:-smells FANTASTIC like a beautiful sweet fruit herb garden-Very thick and moisturizing just how I like my conditioners-Makes my hair curlier (2c-3a)-Makes my hair smooth and less frizzy-lightweight yet very lucious-Makes me happyCons:-there's less in the bottle than you would think. It starts like an inch below the top and isn't very densly packed so I imagine with my very long hair it will go by fast unless I suppliment with another conditioner.-Bottle is plastic (bad for the environment and hard to dispose) it would be great if it was 100% recycled plastic but I couldn't find anything like that. (Maybe I just didn't check the bottle well enough) I understand other alternatives would probably make it expensive and out of my price range though.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive Hydration Conditioner for Dry, Damaged Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Nourish and Soften Hair 13 oz
Title: Verified Purchase
Review: The ingredients listed are not accurate.  See the photo of the bottle I received. It contains limonene which was not listed on Amazon as an ingredient and the photo in the listing has a different ingredient list.  I am allergic to citrus so I cannot eat citrus or have it in my body products.  No limonene, citronellol,  geraniol, etc. It gives me a terrible, red, itchy rash.  This is why I check the ingredients of everything I buy because these substances are in practically everything from deodorant, body wash, laundry detergent, shampoo, etc.  I bought this conditioner after carefully reading the ingredients and then when I received the product, the ingredients were different. I did not notice until after I used it and broke out in a rash. Then I checked the bottle and there it was! Limonene!

Title: Verified Purchase
Review: I have heard a lot of good things about Shea Moisture so decided to dip my toe in the water and change up my routine. I can happily report that I'm glad I did! I have mixed race wavy grade hair and decided that the ingredients would lend this to be an effective leave in, I saw no reason to wash it out. Firstly on opening the bottle I was pleased by the smell, it's gorgeous without being overly cloying. If you're a honey fan like me it's a definite keeper! The slip is good whilst massaging into the scalp and roots, and I have lots of bounce and shine after allowing my hair to naturally air dry. I paired my conditioner with a Shea Moisture shampoo and do believe I will continue with this brand for a while so I'm very glad I found it. My strands feel hydrated from scalp to tip, and my curls last for several days. I can easily detangle my hair with my fingers to keep my hair from breaking, and I have seen great results using this as my regular co wash product every other week.

This is not like that and it makes it a little difficult to tell if I've used enough.I use about five pumps for each half of my hair and then secure it inside a shower cap while I wash the rest of my body before rinsing it off.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: Great for 4b/4c hair maybe any hairtype
Review: Loooove this stuff it made my dry ends so much more moisturized. I left it in for 45 minutes with a shower cap with no heat and my hair felt so great especially during this cold wintery month. Its smells sooo good too!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: Smells like Honey
Review: Review update: Itâ€™s been about two weeks of using this and I am in love!  I have found if I use it in my hair before I step in the shower and leave it for about five minutes, then wash and condition like normal - no smell and no weighing down my curls!My hair (with the protein treatment discussed below every 6 weeks and my leave in conditioner) has been restored to all its curly soft glory!  I canâ€™t believe how much I love this! So happy that I took a chance on this conditioner!Previous review:If I could tell you about my journey through deep conditioner it would be a book and I could tell you some things.My long hair is down to my lower back, course texture, and naturally curly (2b) dark hair. So keeping this mane moisturized is a whole thing, especially when I don't want something to weigh down my curls.I use Aphogee protein treatment first and then I am looking for the deep conditioner in between. I had to try this out after my friend recommended it.1. I loved the way was easy to put on, both thick and easy to apply, not too gooey and thick.2. It smells like Manuka Honey and that scent last, so if you're not into that don't use this. I am still very much on the fence about the smell itself because it's not in my wheelhouse, but it's something you should know if you are sensitive to fragrances.3. Jar is easy to open and close. You would think this is non issue, but when your hands are covered in conditioner and you're paying to keep water out of the pot - this matters way more than I'd like to admit.4. I let it sit for 5 minutes in a gorgeous steam shower, my hair drank it up!5. Rinsing was lovely, it wasn't hard to rinse out and didn't leave a lot of residue on my hair.I air dry after a new deep conditioner to see how it reacts with frizz. So far, I am pretty happy with this. Minimal frizz, but please note my climate is Southern California with little to no moisture in the air.I will be trying another line of conditioners in order to find another smellHappy shopping everyone!

Title: I have 3a/3b hair and this worked wonders!! ðŸ’•
Review: The pic of my wife does it no justice. hereâ€™s her take:I LOVE THIS MASQUE! used it as a deep conditioning treatment with my thermal hair care hot head cap and it was wonderful! Put in moisture into my hair. I sealed it with some cold water and BOOM! It's been insanely humid for some time now and my hair has been getting ball of frizz but this masque improved that greatly! And I normally have to lightly refresh everyday and didnâ€™t need to do a thing but fluff and leave. Iâ€™m very happy with this purchase! ðŸŒ¸

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: Brittle hair beware!
Review: Be careful about how you use this product. My hair needed some moisture after a couple years of damaging color jobs. This mask seemed worth a try after lots of research. Left on my hair ends overnight for two nights.My hair came out in clumps. Actual clumps. I thought I would go bald then and there. Now I'm left with hideous hair ends from a protein overload.Make sure this is what your hair really needs!Pros:Hair was soft after useMask is great consistencySmell is great

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: Too good to be true!
Review: I saw this product for such an amazing price I thought I'd order two, since it would still cost less than what I normally pay for one! I thought I was scoring a deal and was excited. Wrong. It smelled different than the one I normally buy, but it was still just as thick so I figured they had just changed the scent. After rinsing I out, it made my poor hair feel gross and waxy. I couldn't return this fast enough! Lesson learned! If it seems too good to be true, it usually IS.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: Nourishing and lovely.
Review: I Use many of the products. I think itâ€™s a great line. This particular product is very nice for my 4c Hair!It is rich  enough to control the curl pattern. Yet not too greasy. I like that a lot. I alternate with this and a protein treatment every other week to balance and protect! A little goes a long way.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: Play dough?
Review: Pros: softens, thick,Cons: smells like play dough, isnâ€™t nourishing or intensively hydrating.Conclusion: thereâ€™s way better deep conditioner by this brand just not this one.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: My New Go-To deep conditioner!
Review: This conditioner, though! I have used it twice as a once-weekly deep conditioner, and I just love my wash day look! Soft, juicy curls with great definition are actually a thing!  I have really fine, thin 3b curls and this conditioner is great! Week two looked better than week one, but that, I think, is due to a noticeable increase in moisture! I believe my hair to be fairly porous, and hadnâ€™t regularly deep conditioned in a good while, so I am looking forward to week three! Week one, the ends of my hair kept trying do dry, so I had to keep re-wetting. This morning? The ends stayed as damp as the mid-shaft. I highly recommend this product!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: Great moisturizer
Review: I had been struggling with my daughters hair... it seemed like nothing would moisturize  it, after watching tons of videos came upon someone using this mask and decided to try it. Used it in combination with Cantu curl definer- did not rinse it off her hair I used it as a leave in. Loved it

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: Strips hair of moisture! Avoid at all costs!
Review: This product was terrible for my low porosity, high density 4a/4b curls. It had nearly no slip when I put it in but I hoped with some heat and time it would be as great as the reviews say. My hair did get soft with this, but as soon as I washed it out, I immediately felt that dry, filmy feeling coming. By the time I got out the shower, my hair was dry and tangling fast. I had excess shedding when detangling my hair after using this. Needless to say I wonâ€™t be using this again. The search for a deep conditioner continues!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: Read the directions (Honest review)
Review: I've been dying my hair since I was 13 (which was a minute ago) and that plus stripping the color can do tons of damage. Recently, I've gotten on board with getting it healthy, again. I want the weight, the elasticity, the strength of it when I pick it up and let it fall. So, I found this and it seemed fairly decent.PLEASE READ THE DIRECTIONS! When it says "rinse out after FIVE MINUTES" do so. DO NOT leave it in your hair for an hour or overnight, no matter how bad your hair is. You will cause more damage that way. People giving bad product reviews because they can't read directions is pretty sad. It's easy. Wash your hair, use the mask on WET hair, not dry and DO NOT leave it in for more than intended, then, rinse out. This is NOT an immediate fix but it does work. And, no, my hair is not waxy and has not fallen out in clumps.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: Amazing
Review: I don't usually leave reviews, but I had to because I love this conditioner so much.I have EXTREMELY dry 4c hair. It's very picky with products. After getting to know my hair, I noticed that my hair only like products that get absorbed into the hair right away. If it leaves a coating over it, then my hair is not going to like it. It might even feel super soft for a day, but then it get extremely dry after. Even though this product is super thick (so thick that the cream stays in the jar when you flip it upside down), my hair absorbs everything and it stays super moisturized for 2-3 days after. I used this on my hair about 2 days ago. Today, I touched my hair expecting it to feel dry like always, but it felt like I just moisturized it. MIND BLOWN.It also smells AMAZING. It smells more like a fruity, sweet, and creamy perfume fragrance rather than a hair conditioner. It almost reminds me of Mon Guerlain. Literally the nicest smelling hair product I've ever used. 10/10

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: The best conditioner Iâ€™ve ever used :)
Review: First off, I am not associated with this brand economically nor did I receive the product in exchange for my review....This is a smooth, creamy hair moisturizer / pack. Iâ€™ve used a great many over the years and this rates second to only one other, and that one cost $45!!!My hair is very fine and thinning. Yet I can use from my scalp down. Makes hair soft and thick feeling, with no weight on my roots. Additionally  I have a regularly irritated scalp and this helps. Highest recommendation.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: Great product
Review: Great product. Colored my hair (highlights) recently and used it before and after, has been great, hardly any breakage. Love that they don't test on animals and their products are locally and ethically sourced. A percent of your purchase also goes to charity. Don't forget to recycle the tub!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: Unsealed and may have been used
Review: My product came unsealed and it looks like someone might have used a bit.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: I love everything about it! HIGHLY Rec. for Shiny, healthy, hair, bonus- love the fragrance.
Review: I found this in a top 10 masque on-line review. This one rated 2 or 3, and so affordable. I needed for my silver long curly hair. Only have to use a very little. Wash hair with clarifying shampoo, rinse, apply a little to my ends only, wrap my hair in hot towel, sit for 20 min. Rinse.  The fragrance is divine and lasts for a couple days. I air dry, and the shine, the soft curls, the product gives me a healthy beautiful head of hair, and I only have to use it once a month.  I'm sure I could use with heat tools, and be protected. I'll probably use it even more often than once a month, just because I love it so much.Finally, a product that works like its high-end.. that I can afford, large quantity will last a long time.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: Saved my dry bleached hair!!!!
Review: This is the most moisturizing deep conditioners I have ever used! The whole manuka honey & mafura oil line is incredible!!! I have bleached (highlighted blonde) hair and my hair has been so dry and damaged since..until I started using this line of products. Seriously they are SO moisturizing and saved my hair!!! This deep conditioner is the best! I use the shampoo and conditioner and after that I put this deep conditioning mask on for 5 minutes then rinse it out in the shower. I highly highly HIGHLY reccomend this and the whole line..its perfect for dry damaged hair!!! The scent is also very nice and lingers in hair. I love this product!!!!!!!!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: Perfect Hydration
Review: Update 12/27/2021: This order was shipped directly from Shea Moisture. Packaging (jars) are back to normal. It remains my 'go-to' DEEP hydration hair masque. The fragrance is pleasantly soothing yet not overwhelming with long lasting results.Update 11/11/2020: This is still an amazing moisturizing product yet my lastest conflict is the product package shipped. The jar slightly graduated to a smaller based making the label poorly wrap and bubbled. I am no chemist, yet the product appears to have the same look, feel and amazing scent. This hiccup gives me pause has to whether or not this is the actual Shea Moisture product I've ordered & used in the past or a faux product. I am considering returning.Perfect for my (sectionally mixed 3b/4ac) natural hair. Throughly moisturizes my thirsty coif. Hair remains conditioned even after hard sweaty workouts. Leaves my hair touchable with a decent sheen. The fragrance is ok yet works well with my other final product which smells terrific.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: Shea Moisture Intensive Gets the TANGLES OUT!!!!  YAY!!
Review: Shea Moisture Intensive Gets the TANGLES OUT!!!!  YAY!!  I have tried all of the Shea Moisture conditioners, masks and spray detangler.... but after all of my experiments.... THIS IS THE ONE!  This one will get your tangles out, in the shower, before you go to comb out your wet matted hair.  You gotta leave it on for at least 5 minutes, and spray a little water just enough to make it work thru all the hair, don't rinse out yet.... then wait as long as you can.  Try to comb out your wet hair with a bit of water running on your head to help shake out your tangles while combing.... I have GREAT results doing it this way!  (My hair type is blonde, thin, straight, and extremely tangle-y, almost like matted spider webs.) THIS WORKS!  Highly Recommend!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: No moisturize it causes tangles
Review: Hair was very ,dry, and it was snags in my hair strands as I try to finger comb it!  The masque stayed on top my hair and it was stiff feeling as though it was making it about to lock into knots! The hair stuck together like snags in a nylon stocking! Also causes my hair to have breakage along with the shedding made more hair loss! I'm very disappointed and it is a waste of money!  The ingredients changed in Shea Moistures conditioners and masques that it will not work for low porosity hair! It is too thick and stiff. The only thing nice to say is it smells nice. I have to now find conditioner and shampoo with BTMS 50 which is a quaternary ammonia salt. Chemically, it has a positively charged head and is classed as a cationic. It is used as a conditioning emulsifier and will add slip and glide to hair. This will certainly help low porosity hair type.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: Smells horrible with average hydration
Review: I have to use a lot of this product and mix it with water so it actually spreads onto my hair. The hydration is pretty average and I end up using it as a conditioner. It leaves my hair very soft and manageable but the smell, man. It smells like olive oil. I hate the smell of olive oil. It's like they didn't add any fragrance at all. Unless that is the fragrance???? This is me petitioning for Shea to make this smell like vanilla. Nonetheless, it's the only product I've found that makes my very fine very dry hair moisturized enough that I don't rip my hair out on accident attempting to brush it so I'll continue to use it until I find something better. Ugh.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: NEXT LEVEL!!!!
Review: Living outside of the US for years in a country that didn't have a significant ethnic hair population or Amazon access. my hair has suffered.The only upside about being back in the US is access to the products I need(the duality of my love/hate for American consumerism is a whole other topic).Im a guy so I started with the sheamoisture shampoo and conditioner from the same line. Figure that was enough to start my hair repair journey and it was. Both products are amazing.Then a friend suggested a hair masque for deep conditioning . No clue what either of those were. Bought the masque and deep conditioned.OMG this MASQUE!!!! The normal conditioner was great and will continue to use that for my wash and go's but the masque is a must have for my weekly deep conditionThe difference was immediate. Your hair instantly feels healthier and softer and smells amazing100% Recommend

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
The media could not be loaded.
                




  Â I used this deep conditioner alongside a color deposit mask and left it on for one hour and my hair is silky smooth. I have used this conditioner on its own and my hair feels moisturized soft manageable. This is definitely my go to deep conditioner after color or protein treatments. I also use it weekly to keep my hair healthy. I have thick curly hair so to have it sleek and straight is a blessing. Get this conditioner you will not regret it. I suggest using this 1-2 times per week if you have dry hair.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: Best thing you could do for your hair!
Review: I have thin white girl hair that dries out & breaks very easily. I've been on a journey to grow it out & take better care of it for the past few years & only just started looking in to hair masks (I know, I'm disappointed in myself too).I was looking for something that would be simple for a beginner & I found this beautiful product. I love the smell of coconut, so that was very persuasive, but I was not expecting it to smell THAT amazing. Honestly, sometimes I'd just open the jar & sniff it just for the sake of sniffing it.You get a hefty amount for the size of the container. Mine was filled to the brim & I used a decent amount of it on my hair at least once a week; didn't even make a dent. Granted, I don't have super thick hair, so that might vary for other people. It's a little tricky to apply if you don't go section by section to really rub it in, but that's a given because it's so full of moisturizer. Put it up in a clip, leave it in for as long as possible, wash it out with lukewarm water & my hair would feel softer than any conditioner I've ever used, & I'd smell like coconut for days after the fact. Again, I cannot stress enough how delicious it smells.My only complaint is that when my first container came, the paper seal on the inside was broken for some reason. Luckily it hadn't made any kind of mess on the lid or in the package box, but just a thing I felt needed to be mentioned.Also, something I learned the hard way; you are not able to comb/brush through your hair with this mask on. It does it job & hangs on to your hair until washed out with water. I though I'd put the mask on & braid my hair to keep it locked in longer, but that didn't pan out like I though it would & I ended up breaking my hair quite a bit trying to figure out why I couldn't comb through it (completely my fault, I have no one to blame but myself). However, if you braid your hair BEFORE putting the mask on & then slather the braids up after, it works perfectly fine.Over all, I absolutely love this product & am looking to get another if I don't manage to find the tub I somehow miss-placed about a week ago. 10/10 would recommend to anyone with any type of hair looking for some major hydration & sweet sweet coconut smells.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: Miracle: Repaired Damaged Hair!
Review: I bought this hair masque for my grandma because her hair was becoming extremely dry and brittle. In addition, her scalp was itchy and it was overall and unpleasant experience. Previously, I bought her other products because I assumed it was dandruff. As a last resort, I got the hair masque and Iâ€™m glad I did.Within 2 weeks, her hair regained its wavy texture and became softer and even shiny! Her hair transformed so much to the point itâ€™s literally a miracle. So, I advised her to scrunch in the hair masque right after coming out of the shower (on wet hair) and to just leave it until her hair dries.I also got a chance to see the hair masque in person...and wow. It smells amazing, like in a natural way, rather than a chemical way. Also, the product is really thick and dense. It took a good minute to wash the product off my hands. That, in my opinion, is what makes this product top quality. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a very moisturizing product.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: Caution: I received not genuine product
Review: What I received was already opened.  The safety seal was cracked and broken at the halfway mark with dirt on the edge of it, and the product inside the container had been scooped out and replaced with ?  It smelled really bad and I wasn't about to use an unknown product that had been tampered with.  Was hoping the other negative reviews were anomalies, but they were not.  :(

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: If you bleach, itâ€™s a must!
Review: As you can see from my profile pictures I like to color my hair with vibrant colors. I have Native American hair so bleaching takes A LOT out of my hair. I use this product daily a week before starting the bleaching process and immediately after. My hair feels great! Usually after bleaching my hair feels like a rubber band wig, but after using this mask you can barely tell that I have bleached my hair from the feel of it. My hair is soft, strong, and healthy as can be. I highly recommend this product! It smells good, it works great, and itâ€™s not overly pricey.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: Works well!
Review: I have medium-thick curly hair and was a little worried to try this after some of the reviews. My hair gets very very dry in the winter time especially with it being curly. This deep conditioner smells like vanilla and yes it does have a fairly strong smell. To me itâ€™s not overwhelming but the perfect amount, you can definitely still smell it the next day. If a stronger scent isnâ€™t your thing, I donâ€™t recommend this at all. Another thing is that this is a thick deep conditioner and it does take awhile to wash out. I highly highly recommend using a brush while in the shower to brush it through your hair at least a little bit. Overall, this conditioner works pretty well!  My hair felt nice and smooth afterwards and helped with the tangles. Doesnâ€™t leave a residue as long as you wash it all out of your hair.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: It's not bad, but....
Review: This product is not bad.  I usually use it as a deep conditioner on my locs. I put it through my entire hair from root, to ends and sit under the hair dryer for about 45 min to 1hr. I don't deep condition it every time I wash it but maybe every 2-3 months. I've also used this and just sat with a shower cap on,  slept in it and washed it out in the morning. It does soften my hair, and I can tell it puts moisture in my hair.  My problem is residue. Even after being washed out if leave residue in my hair that won't come off unless I take a wash cloth and rub it out of my hair.  It's actually frustrating bc I have locs, I try not have things that leaves residue behind. It also makes my hair look grayish or whitish in the area where the residue is. The conditioner it's self is kind of thick in nature and clumpy,  not like cottage cheese but like Greek yogurt maybe idk. Maybe the v results will differ without locs but I doubt it.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: Essential for curly hair!
Review: I love this product. I just love it. I don't think I'll ever stop using it.I have fine hair, and my curls did not have much definition before I started consciously caring for it. I follow some aspects of the Curly Girl Method, and I try to avoid harsh chemicals on my hair. It seemed like this mask was recommended by so many 'curly girls' , and was free of those harsh chemicals, so I decided to give it a try. I wash my hair twice a week, and use this mask once a week. So in my second wash of the week, I apply this mask after cleansing with low-poo shampoo. My results last into my second wash. My curls are SHINY and defined.I've noticed my curls are not as tight or shiny when I don't use this mask. It definitely makes a difference in my hair. I highly recommend.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: Great Mask

After I rinse this out it feels like I just shampoo and it leaves my hair frizzy and brittle. I think it also contains protein, which might be the cause of why my hair felt dry and brittle.UPDATE: This mask is actually a REALLY good mask. Iâ€™ve been using it wrong however. When I was experimenting with this product one last time, I noticed my hair was extremely defined, moisturized, and strengthened. I used this product with the Miele Organics Rosemary Mint Strengthening Mask and used a deep conditioning plastic cap. The definition I got was so unexpected. I love this mask now. I use it once every 3 weeks-once a month.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz

I was dealing with a ton of dryness and bad texture but after I started using this regularly, itâ€™s been so much easier to keep my hair moisturized and healthy.I havenâ€™t used this as a longer 30 min mask so I donâ€™t know if there are any benefits for using it longer. I tend it use it more like a regular hair conditioner but itâ€™s made a big difference and Iâ€™ve repurchased it twice.One thing to note: if you have a lot of hair or really thick hair, youâ€™ll run through this pretty quickly so keep that in mind. If youâ€™re very generous with deep conditioners or need to use a lot of product to cover all of your hair this may not be a great product because youâ€™ll need to buy this too frequently.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: Frizz-Free, Fuss-Free Product Leaves Hair Luxuriously Baby-Soft (No Kidding!)

I then go about my usual household activities before finally rinsing it out in the sink. It leaves my hair baby-soft, and allows my curls to thrive - without the unwanted frizz & fuss! It's amazing how soft it makes my aging hair, and leaves me feeling great.I had been buying this at the drugstore in smaller, individual packets that ended up costing me more, but was so happy to find it in a larger, more economical quantity on Amazon. Thank you! ðŸ˜ðŸ‘

Title: Perfect deep conditioner to maintain protein and moisture balance

It smells amazing and it leaves my hair soft (but not overly moisturized) and strong; perfectly ready to take in my leave in conditioner. My natural hair has been stagnant to my shoulders and it's now slowly but surely making it's way to bra strap length. I have been tempted to try more deep conditioners but as high school musical said, stick to what you know! And also, what's not broken, don't fix so I'm not going to bother with anything else.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: BEST LOW COST HYDRATING HAIR MASK OUTTHERE!!!

It lasts a long time because it's really concentrated, and the smell is really good. However, if you're looking to straighten your hair just like I do, be sure to use a good termination product because this mask doesn't help much in adding the needed softness you look for in a blow out; despite that, I would recommend this hair mask to everyone who is looking for a good shot of hydration and shine for a low cost.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: Use it for 2 purposes

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: This product is fake??

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: Good for low porosity, strong smell

I have low porosity hair, so I was a bit concerned about all the heavy oils in it, but if you cover your hair with a shower cap and heat it with a hairdryer for 15 minutes or so (as directed on the packaging), it gets absorbed without leaving any grease or oils behind. My hair feels nice and soft, and it really helped my elasticity.My one problem is that it has a really strong smell. It's not a bad smell, but it's strong, and it's taken me a while to get used to it. If strong, heavy fragrances really bother you, or give you headaches, DO NOT buy this product! As is, I don't think I'll buy it again, but I don't mind it enough to return it. Hope this helps!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: First deep conditioning product I've enjoyed!
Review: I haven't really been taking care of my hair over the past year due to long hours at work, stressful family issues, etc. I use a basic shampoo with sulfates, but I've tried sulfate-free shampoos and the result is always the same: as my hair dries, even if I don't touch it, it starts to frizz and feel very rough and coarse. Once in awhile I'll try and blow-dry it which seems to help slightly but it never really feels good to the touch and I'm sure the heat isn't helping long-term so I just end up putting it up due to how bad it looks.I saw this at the store and got it on a whim, and I'm so glad I did! I wasn't really expecting much out of it but after one use my hair is noticeably softer and silkier. I didn't even leave it on that long, so I'm pleased with how much less dry and frizzy my hair feels. It's actually very soft to the touch and after it dried, I didn't even put it up because it actually looked nice! It's the only thing I changed up in my hair routine so I know it's this product that's causing the improvement. I basically just shampooed my hair, put a generous amount of this product in and finger-combed from roots to ends, then did the rest of my shower routine before fully rinsing it out. It was probably on my hair for under 10 minutes.Since I've only used it one time, I'll update the review in the future if I notice any negatives. But for now I definitely will start using it more often. It also smells amazing which is a huge bonus!!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: Amazing conditioner for swimmers hair 1c type
Review: Swimming is not kind to your hair or skin. This conditioner is amazing! Don't waste your money on hair products marketed for "swimmers". I used Suave Daily Clarifying shampoo and left the mask in my hair  to shave and wash off a facial mask, about 10 minutes. Its as soft as it was before I started swimming again. Once I run out of the current shampoo I will give the shampoo in the same collection a try. Will be stocking up on this product. Again, amazing.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: Left my hair feeling nice and soft.
Review: Used this once so far and my hair feels softer.  I have very thick, course hair and regular conditioners just make my hair limp.  I applied it to my dry hair, put on a plastic cap [or you could wrap your hair in plastic wrap], left in on for 20+ minutes and then showered and washed my hair.It's nice and thick so there's no running or dripping.  Will probably just use it once a month.  Doesn't have much of a scent but nice enough.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: Acts more like a protein treatment, made hair hard!
Review: I was in the market for a moisturizing hair masque. Something to make my 4b hair feel soft and hydrated. Read the reviews and bought. It came and the seal with already broken which was already a red flag. It smells like typical shea moisture products, not fruity at all more like essential oils which I expected. Put it on my hair and left it on for half an hour. Rinsed it out and my hair felt hard and was extremely hard to detangle. Would not recommend. Will stick to the Raw sugar avocado and banana oil masque, it works like a dream & is 10 bucks at target!

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: Worked as promised
Review: I rarely leave reviews on here, but this hair masque is worth every penny.My hair ( mostly the bottom four inches) was pretty damaged from the summer. I was out playing golf in the sun four days a week or more and the sun really bleached out my hair.I haven't been going to the salon due to COVID, and my hair literally looked and felt like straw.I dampened my hair and worked a good bit of the masque into the damaged portion, ran it through with a wide tooth comb, and let it sit for about an hour.Rinsed it out, washed my roots/scalp, conditioned the ends and rinsed thoroughly, then blow dried.The difference is HUGE. Silky soft ends, no more straw hair.  This went way beyond my expectations, I'm thrilled!Highly recommend. 10/10.

Product: SheaMoisture Intensive for Dry,12 oz
Title: Hydration Low Prosity Hair Must Have !!
Review: This is a must have for low porosity dry damage broken hair!! This makes my 3c, 4 a,b,c hair soft, silky, hydrated and have my waves and curls popping!!  Finally found something that works to strengthen my natural hair.
