Product: Shea Moisture Manuka Honey & Mafura Oil Intensive Hydration Hair Masque, with African Rock Fig & Baobab Oil, 12 Ounce - 2 pack
Title: Best hair masque I've tried
Review: Upon initial application of the manuka honey & mafura oil masque I was not impressed. I found there was not a lot of slip with the product. I have type 3b/3c/4a hair. However after 35 minutes under a heating cap, I couldn't believe the moisture level and the definition of my curls. Best masque I've used to date. The masque is worth the hype, so much so that I purchased the remainder of the hair care line.

Product: Shea Moisture Manuka Honey & Mafura Oil Intensive Hydration Hair Masque, with African Rock Fig & Baobab Oil, 12 Ounce - 2 pack
Title: I WILL BUY THIS UNTIL THEY STOP MAKING IT!
Review: I have used many conditioners specifically for more hair moisture.  Of that lot, the best were Organic Root Stimulator's (ORS) Olive Oil Replenishing Conditioner and Nexxus Humectress.  Both have more chemicals than I would like, and I was searching for something more natural as I am now relying on keratin treatments.I decided to try good old Shea Moisture.  I am more familiar with their body washes, scrubs, and lotions than hair products, but as this was a package deal that gave 2 conditioners, I decided to give this a try.Wow what a difference!  No matter what I have done to my hair, it is soft.  And I can use it with my daughter's natural hair, too. She has a great deal of it, very long, with a looser curl pattern.  You don't need much of it to saturate your hair with it, and it is mostly (all?) natural!

Product: Shea Moisture Manuka Honey & Mafura Oil Intensive Hydration Hair Masque, with African Rock Fig & Baobab Oil, 12 Ounce - 2 pack
Title: Intense Moisture
Review: This is a very, very moisturizing deep conditioner.  I purchased it to ensure I put moisture back in my hair after a recent relaxer.  It did not fail me at all.  It has a lot of slip, doesnâ€™t take a lot to coat your strands, and it smells amazing.  I sat under a dryer for 30 minutes to get the most out of the conditioner.  Once rinsed, comb out was a breeze.  I recommend this to anyone with relaxed or natural hair in need of intense moisture.  I will definitely buy again.

Product: Shea Moisture Manuka Honey & Mafura Oil Intensive Hydration Hair Masque, with African Rock Fig & Baobab Oil, 12 Ounce - 2 pack
Title: Best Mask
Review: This has been my go-to hair mask for a long time now. I have fine (diameter of each hair shaft is small) but thick (a very large number of strands) hair, which is also wavy, curly, frizzy. It is very difficult to manage, in my own opinion and that of professional hair stylists too! I use this mask *after every* shampoo, rather than conditioner. I'll concentrate the mask at mid to ends of my hair, and then run the remainder of the mask across my roots, to give them some moisture without weighing down my roots too much. I then gently run a wide tooth comb through my hair and gently massage each section  to work the mask into the strands. After that I pile my hair on top of my head, loosely with a clip and cover my hair in a plastic shower cap and do the rest of my showering (exfoliating, shaving, etc.) Every now and then, if my hair needs extra moisture and softening, I'll put a towel turban over the plastic shower cap, to trap some of the heat from my head which helps the mask penetrate into the hairs, then get out of the shower, letting the mask sit for a half hour or so before rinsing with cool/cold water. This mask has definitely helped a lot with keeping each strand moisturized and preventing breakage, which occurs for me when my fine hairs are overly dried out. It does the most work for minimizing frizz, so then I only need my everyday styling products to do the rest.For my hair type, this mask is NOT too heavy but I have friends with thin (quantity of strands) fine (diameter of strands) hair, who said it made their hair look oily and weighed down.It smells *delicious*, with a hint of honey. The formula itself is very thick and is in a soft, solid form in the tub, which makes it feel very luxurious and nourishing. This is one of the only products I buy in bulk with automatic orders!

Product: Shea Moisture Manuka Honey & Mafura Oil Intensive Hydration Hair Masque, with African Rock Fig & Baobab Oil, 12 Ounce - 2 pack
Title: My new fave
Review: This stuff is great! Moisturizes 4c hair very well.

I use it as a regular conditioner with a shower cap for twenty minutes and get great results and I use it as a deep conditioner sitting under a dryer for 30 minutes and there is nothing that compares! I love, love, love this product and highly recommend it. Wish I could give it more stars.

When I rinsed it I kept going thinking it wasnt coming out..... NOPE! IT WAS JUST THAT MOISTURIZED!!!! it's like my hair drank in all the moisture and had permanent slip! Product: Shea Moisture Manuka Honey & Mafura Oil Intensive Hydration Hair Masque, with African Rock Fig & Baobab Oil, 12 Ounce - 2 pack
Title: 8 months in REVIEW
Review: The product is amazing! It detangles your hair while putting it on. I have curly medium to course wait length hair if that helps you understand. I would not use any other MASK on my hair, and to be fair I even use it as a conditioner most days as it's so moisturizing.You feel the quality of product when it is on your hair and not just a mask of product! It is almost as if you see your hair soak it in ( Don't know this statement until you try it! )I even suggest using this as a leave-in conditioner at times for those with very dry hair as it works amazing for my curls and looks great!Overall 15 out of 10!! Product: Shea Moisture Manuka Honey & Mafura Oil Intensive Hydration Hair Masque, with African Rock Fig & Baobab Oil, 12 Ounce - 2 pack
Title: I canâ€™t find silicones in the ingredients but it seems like there is
Review: Ok. First things first. Iâ€™m a dude. I have low porosity hair that is like 4a, coily!  So, i have a blend of textures that range from curls ( Beaty beads) to coils that look like springs. The leave in conditioner from This line, if i apply it and use a little heat from the blow dryer , it is amazing! I figured this would be too.The first time i used it, i was like â€œ wowâ€. My curl pattern was extended and though my coils werenâ€™t what they usually are my hair with gel would sort of clump and then disperse. I was kinda into it because it looked like a different style. Well that was day 1. Day 2-5, it was clear that whatever is in this stuff doesnâ€™t come out without a fight. I work out daily so i would Come from the gym rinse my hair and apply more leave in and gel and it was like my hair couldnâ€™t absorb any other product , AND, this left my hair dry.I tried it the next week and the results werenâ€™t even close. Even with the shampoo from this line it canâ€™t get this stuff out my hair. I figured if it did , maybe i needed to reset/wash my hair midweek? Nope. I cannot find silicones in this but if you read the properties of silicones and how they interact with hair , SOMETHING in this does that to my hair in that it repels any other moisture or product fromAbsorbing into it for weeks at a time. Also, the so called moisturizing effect is short lived. It feels like there is clay or putty in my hair that i cannot get rid of. I literally went out and bought some neutralizing shampoo as i hope it gets this out.Iâ€™m still in the market for a good deep conditioner cause this, ainâ€™t it.

Product: Shea Moisture Manuka Honey & Mafura Oil Intensive Hydration Hair Masque, with African Rock Fig & Baobab Oil, 12 Ounce - 2 pack
Title: Finally
Review: I'm not a huge Shea moisture person I've tried some of their popular products and didn't work for my hair. As well as trying other products from other brands after all these years the line that I was using was the reason for my dry desert-like hair so, I needed to revamp everything. I was very surprised that there's a Shea Moisture product that actually worked for me. This has made my hair so soft and silky for days and it did an excellent job at detangling my hair. The smell; however, is not very good, but given the fact that it made my hair feel very moisturized for days makes up for it. This masque definitely does what it says its supposed to do. This is now a staple in routine every week. The consistency is very thick and it does leave residue, but I did put too much and didn't rub it in very well so maybe next time I'll will put less. But overall despite the terrible smell very impressed with this masque.

Product: Shea Moisture Manuka Honey & Mafura Oil Intensive Hydration Hair Masque, with African Rock Fig & Baobab Oil, 12 Ounce - 2 pack
Title: Ehhh...Could Be Better
Review: Alright yâ€™all, this one did not do it for me. I am currently in my curly hair transition from straighting my hair for over 20 years. I saw this and I thought it would be great!However, although it did most moisturize my hair, I felt that my hair was greasier than going into the shower. It just felt very oily and Iâ€™m not sure if itâ€™s suppose to do that or not. I could feel the oils go all over my face and shoulders when I would sleep or throughout the day and it made me want to take a shower again. Iâ€™ve tried having it on over night, 20 minutes, 10 minutes, and even 5 minutes with the conditioner on and I still got the same results. Greasy.Also, it had this smell to it that I just did not like. Even after thoroughly washing it out that smell would stay with me for the next two day. It eventually made me nauseous. Overall this just wasnâ€™t for me. Maybe itâ€™s great on someone else. But I wouldnâ€™t use this again.

Product: Shea Moisture Manuka Honey & Mafura Oil Intensive Hydration Hair Masque, with African Rock Fig & Baobab Oil, 12 Ounce - 2 pack
Title: YES YES YES!!!
Review: The whole Manukau honey set (the shampoo, conditioner, and deep conditioner) did WONDERS for my hair! I saw this method on TikTok where you condition your hair first, shampoo, and then deep condition (Iâ€™ll abbreviate it as the C/S/DC method ðŸ˜œ) and BABY let me tell youâ€¦ my hair has never felt softer and more moisturized! I was a little skeptical at first but now I HIGHLY recommend it if you have dry, low porosity, brittle hair that breaks easily! I used to have TERRIBLE breakage! I mean like losing 3-5 HANDFULS of hair no matter WHAT I did! Iâ€™ve tried several different shampoos, conditioners, and deep conditionersâ€¦ many different oils, Iâ€™ve tried finger detanglingâ€¦ I get regular trims from a licensed hairstylist but NOTHING would help with the breakage but babyâ€¦ doing the C/S/DC method with these products has reduced my breakage GREATLY! In the pic is the amount of hair Iâ€™ve lost from START to FINISH!!! Just a palm full!!! My hair has never felt softer and so moisturized and hydrated!!!! I cannot believe that method with these products reduced my hair breakage that much!!!!!!! Product: Shea Moisture Manuka Honey & Mafura Oil Intensive Hydration Hair Masque, with African Rock Fig & Baobab Oil, 12 Ounce - 2 pack
Title: We love it for high porosity 3b/3c hair!
Review: My daughter's hair is very very dry naturally.  She is only one and a half years old. I use this as a mask and also as conditioner. When we wash her hair this is what is used for conditioner because nothing else will work. It is very very thick and although a little goes a long way, I put a lot to get the slip I need to comb out her tangles.  She has very sensitive skin and this hasn't broken her skin out thankfully. It is very highly perfumed and even though I'm not one for strong scents- I'm okay with this one.I mainly wash her hair just once a week.  But because she a toddler, she will get food in her hair while feeding herself.  I will use this when I rinse her hair after dinner if it's necessary.  Its extremely moisturizing and leaves her hair with a softness I cannot otherwise achieve.

Title: BUY IT!!!

I have wavy, fine, thick, and notably textured hair, and have always struggled with dryness and frizz. This makes my hair the softest of any product I've used before, and it's sweet smell is not only great but lasts nicely too. A little bit goes a long way (as in 1 tub per ~14 months when using it as my conditioner), not to mention it's frighteningly cheap for how well it works ...!!! I've also used it as a mask on my friend with dry scalp/coarse hair, and it relieved her itching for the following week-- she's buying it now, which reminded me to write this review :) great stuff, just seeing it in the shower gives me a feeling of relief lol

Product: Sheamoisture Hydration Hair Milk for Dry Hair Manuka Honey and Mafura Oil to Hydrate and Style Hair 8 oz
Title: Great stuff!!
Review: I have type 2A hair that was down to my lower back & Iâ€™ve kept it that way for my whole life. I donâ€™t cut it, style it, blow dry it & use as natural/organic of products that I can. HASK & Live Clean were my go-to brands for the last few years.Then on New Years in 2019 I decided to have a little fun & got 8 inches trimmed off, bleached the lower half & dyed it blue. Fast forward to the end of 2020, with the color almost faded out I decided to finish off my bottle of dye & colored it again. Fast forward to a couple months ago? I started getting split ends which NEVER happened before, then the hairs starting snapping off. I was told that between the new job I took last year that requires me to work outdoors in all manner of weather 6 days a week & the stress of the coloring, it decided to revolt. Needless to say I was kinda panicky.After doing some reading on how to possibly save my hair I decided on the following routine:Olly Gummies 3 chews a day instead of 2.Viori Brand Rice Water Shampoo & Condtioner Bars.Shea Moisture Manuka Honey + Mafura Oil Leave-in Hair Milk.Plus keeping it braided more often than I usually do, especially at night.I tried the Jamaican Black Castor Oil repair masque & didnâ€™t see any changes with it so this Hair Milk was my next attempt. I wish Iâ€™d gotten it sooner! The smell isnâ€™t overpowering which is great for me, & itâ€™s easy to apply. Itâ€™s pretty thick, like the consistency of conditioner & a little goes a long way. I put it on my whole head directly after a shower & comb through it. I donâ€™t have a greasy feeling once itâ€™s dry. I have half a bottle left but Iâ€™ll be buying more once I run out!Iâ€™ve been doing this for 2 months & finally thought to take photos just 17 days apart & I can definitely see a difference!! Even my friends can tell & my Aunt who is a retired Stylist. If you are struggling with breakage & split ends I would definitely recommend this overall routine.****UPDATE: Added third picture on 8/17. Still improving!
